Doña Rosibel is requesting a loan in order to pay for school expenses such as tuition, uniforms, notebooks, and other items that her young children will need.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, uniforms, notebooks, and other items.

loans.name: Dúo Florecitas De Tecpan Group

texts.es:
DUO FLORECITAS DE TECPAN
Doña Alicia ella es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 38 años de edad y bajo su responsabilidad están  sus 4 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y a la venta de leñas, Y crianza de gallinas
Desde hace varios años ella ha empezado con la venta de tortillas y poco a poco fue viendo la necesidad de vender leña ya que sus clientes le piden y por eso ella vio la necesidad de ampliar  un poco su negocio.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos doña Alicia sigue trabajando para poder mejor su calidad de vida ya que toda su familia está apoyando en el negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos  a  la   escuela  para un futuro mejor.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña para la venta.
texts.en:
This is the "Dúo Florecitas de Tecpan" ("Duo of Little Flowers from Tecpan") communal bank.
Alicia comes from Tecpan. She's 38 years old and has four underage children under her care. She sells tortillas and firewood, and raises chickens.
She first started selling tortillas several years ago, and gradually she realized she needed to sell firewood as well, since her customers ask her for it. That's why she realized she needed to somewhat expand her business.
Thanks to her husband's and her children's support, Alicia keeps on working so she can improve her living conditions. Her entire family helps her in the business.
Her dream is to further expand her business. That way she'll increase her profits and send her children to school so they may have a brighter future. She's requesting this loan in order to purchase corn and firewood for selling.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for selling.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, de 38 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pedro con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo cuida de 3 de ellos: Joel, Pedro Enrique y Luz Esther, en la casa que compró hace 6 años. Su trabajo es noble y gusta mucho de cuidar a los niños de su pueblo. Desde hace 6 años emprendió este trabajo su carácter noble y sus ganas de ayudar a las mujeres que necesitan que alguien cuide de sus hijos, la motivo a abrir una cuna donde cuida a 8 niños todos los días, desde las primeras horas hasta el atardecer. Al mes recibe un promedio de dinero suficiente para que ella pueda solventar algunos gastos del hogar, mientras su esposo se dedica al noble oficio de aserradero. Ahora ella desea ampliar y mejorar sus instalaciones para que pueda brindar una mejora atención a los niños, asimismo empieza a incursionar en la fabricación de ropa junto a su hija; quien trabaja en la capital dentro de ese rubro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Alejandra, invertirá el dinero en la compra de materiales para adornar su cuna y si el dinero le alcanza comprará una máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 38 years old and is a simple woman. She lives with her husband Pedro, with whom she has 4 children. At present, she only needs to care for 3 of them: Joel, Pedro Enrique, and Luz Esther. They live in a house she bought some 6 years ago. Her work is noble and and she enjoys it very much: caring for the children of her town. 


For the last 6 years, Alejandra has undertaken this work because of her noble character and her desire to help women who need child care for their children. That's why she opened this nursery, where she cares for 8 children every day, from the earliest hours until late in the day. Each month she receives an amount of money sufficient for her to cover some of the household costs, while her husband dedicates his efforts to the worthy business of operating a sawmill. 

Now, Alejandra wishes to expand and improve her installation in order to offer the children better attention. Also, she wants to start a clothes-making business with her daughter, who works in the capital in this same field. Alejandra belongs to “The Child Jesus” Communal Bank and this is her 11th loan through MFP. She appreciates the opportunity to progress, and promises to be punctual in making her payments. Moreover, she likes belonging to the association, where everyone is united and supportive.   

Alejandra will invest the money in purchasing materials to adorn her nursery and, if there is sufficient money remaining, she will buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: buy materials to decorate her child care center and if there is sufficient money, to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Namono A Group

texts.en:
Basilisa’s group has ten farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Basilisa is pictured on the right of Namono A Group with her hand raised.  She is pictured amongst the three men and seven women of her group. 

Basilisa will receive input loans capable of planting ½ acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Basilisa’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, access the best input prices, grow enough food for the family, and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Last year, Basilisa harvested ½ bag of maize on ¼ acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, repair her home, and invest in a cow. 

Basilisa’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total, they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 39 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with four children who are aged between 17 years and 11 years old.

Gideon has a transport business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to repair his motorbike and buy engine oil.

Gideon hopes to buy extra motorbikes in the near future and also buy a piece of land to do some dairy farming.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike and buy engine oil.

loans.name: Emelda Yahoska

texts.es: La joven universitaria Emelda de 21 años estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas con cuatro años de duración quien ya está cursando su último año, le ayudan sus padres quienes pagan sus estudios ya que ella actualmente no está trabajando, pero su objetivo principal es culminar su profesión por eso ella solicita apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación para finalizarlo y así poder buscar empleo lo que beneficiaria a la familia ya que sería otra fuente de ingreso y eso ayudaría al desarrollo económico de su hogar.
texts.en: 21 year-old university student Emelda is studying a four-year degree course in systems engineering. She is in her final year and her parents pay for her studies as she is not currently working. Her main goal is to finish her course and she is requesting a loan to pay her professional title fees so that she can graduate and look for a job. This would benefit her family as it would provide another source of income and would support the economic development of their household.

loans.use: to pay her professional title fees

loans.name: Vereryano

texts.en: Vereryano is a 50-year-old  married man living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy maize and coffee to sell. Vereryano is a farmer who also trades in coffee and maize. He dreams of educating his four children, building a permanent house and buying a car or motorcycle to ease his transportation problems. Vereryano intends to use the loan to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1966. She has two married children who are laborers. Hue's husband is an electricity worker, earning about 4,000,000 VND per month. Hue raises chickens, earning about 3,000,000 VND. The family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Hue has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She always wants to upgrade her chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Nasinga Group

texts.en:
Nasinga is a group of 12 women farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Gladys, on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Gladys will receive farming inputs on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Gladys is a new One Acre Fund farmer. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to use the increased profits to send her children to school. 

Gladys describes her last year's harvest as good but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit, for a group total of 6 acres' worth of inputs.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has a grocery business in Nakuru where she sells tomatoes, onions, and vegetables, among other items. She is 23 years old and a single mother of one child.

This will be Esther's second loan, which she plans to use to buy more potatoes, carrots, and vegetables for sale. Demand being high from her clients, she anticipates making more profits with which she'll buy more grocery items such as cereals and fruits. In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business, make more income, and provide for her child's needs. She also plans to open a boutique business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en:
Trading is a very good and lucrative business in Ghana so many people like to trade, including salaried workers. Agnes’s group is no exception, as these seven women sell fish, foodstuffs, firewood and palm oil. The group has been together for four years, with more women wanting to join.

Agnes, the group leader, is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. She sells fish, her husband is a mason and her two children attend school. Agnes has been running her business for 10 years and her customers patronize it  very well. She is requesting a loan of 500 GHS to buy enough fish to sell to her customers.

The group needs a total of 4,400 GHS to buy more items to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Wekelekha Group

texts.en:
Nickson is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Wekelekha Group members. The 13 of them, 6 women and 7 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Nickson will receive farming inputs on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Nickson’s first with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to access the best input prices and to grow enough food for the family. He also wanted to learn from One Acre Fund's agricultural trainings.

Last year, Nickson harvested 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. He is excited to improve his harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to invest in a cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit, for a group total of 6.5 acres' worth of inputs.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 50 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Celia y sus 2 hijos: Alexander y Ángelo, a los que cuida en su casa propia desde hace 20 años. 
Gusta desde hace 12 años en la reparación de carros y motos, pues siempre tuvo curiosidad del funcionamiento de estos medios de trasporte. Comenta que durante todo su tiempo pudo adquirir la experiencia para poder ser uno de los mejores de la ciudad, “hay pocos mecánicos en la ciudad, es por esa razón que el negocio es rentable, acostumbro a trabajar con mi propio capital de trabajo, pero esta vez me faltó dinero para un repuesto”, comenta. Por ahora desea seguir mejorando su trabajo y capacitándose muchos más.
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Jesús, invertirá el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo, como grasa y algunos repuestos que le faltan.
texts.en:
Jesús, 50, is a working man. He lives with his wife Celia and their 2 children: Alexander and Angelo, whom he takes care of in his own home of 20 years.
For 12 years he has worked in repairing cars and motorcycles, because he was always curious of how these forms of transport functioned. 

Jesús says that through time, he could gain the experience to be one of the best in town, "There are few mechanics in town, so for that reason the business is profitable.  I am used to working with my own working capital, but this time I lacked money for a replacement part" he says. For now he wants to further improve his work and train himself more.

This is his 2nd loan with MFP, which he hopes with their collaboration, to continue with his objectives.  He promises once again to comply with the payment of his dues. Jesús also likes to be part of the communal bank because all its members are responsible and very supportive.

Jesús will invest the money in buying materials for his work, such as oil and other replacement parts that he needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work, such as oil and other replacement parts that he needs.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a 52-year-old independent woman. Since 2002, she has been running a vegetable shop in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Jamila is the mother of 2 sons, one a shopkeeper and the other working privately.

Jamila purchases fresh vegetables from the field and sells them in the main market. Currently she is interested in purchasing a variety of vegetables but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Therefore, as a member of a seven-person lending group, Jamila has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the profit from the loan to open a new vegetable shop in the main market. Jamila sends very best wishes and many thanks to all Kiva staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai was born in 1963. She has two children; one is a carpenter and one is a seller. Thai's husband is a carpenter, earning about 3,500,000 VND per month. For the past 15 years, Thai has been selling clothes, earning about 3,000,000 VND monthly. The family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Thai has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more clothes to sell. She always wants to enlarge her clothes store.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is 37 years old. She is married to Gatama and together they have one child. She sells secondhand clothes and has been in the business for the past eleven years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of clothes for resale and to pay for transport.

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen was born in 1977. She has a child who is 11 years old. Her husband and she are divorced. 

Huyen sells dried food in the market to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

Huyen has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy more dried food to sell. 

She always wants to raise her child up well.

loans.use: to buy more dried food to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos,  vive con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida.  Wilfredo tiene 3 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar como ser: planchas, licuadoras, gaveteros, chineros, mesas plásticas, sillas, estufas, colchones etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 8000 lempiras para surtir más el negocio de artículos como vajillas, planchas, mesas, sillas,  y otros que los clientes piden.  Este préstamo le ayudara a capitalizarse para mantener inventario y obtener más utilidades. Su meta es trabajar para que el negocio crezca y sus hijos logren graduarse.
texts.en: Wilfredo, 42, is married and has two children; he lives with his wife and children in a village in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida.  He’s had his own business selling household items for three years.  He sells things like irons, blenders, file cabinets, china cabinets, plastic tables and chairs, stoves, mattresses, etc.  He sells from place to place.  He’s asking for an 8,000 Lempira loan to stock his business with cookware, irons, tables, chairs and other items his customers request.  This loan will help him capitalize in order to maintain inventory and earn higher profits.  His goal is to work so his business grows and his children are able to graduate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ridah

texts.en:
Ridah is a 73-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya, where she lives. She is widowed and has four children who have all finished schooling. She has been in farming for the past thirty years, producing maize, poultry products, horticultural crops and milk, which she sells at the nearby market in her area. She makes and sells bricks as an additional source of income.

Ridah is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income, which will help her uplift her living standards. She aspires to have six dairy cows in the next five years.

Competition and unreliable workers are her major challenges in farming.

Ridah is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for helping her improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que diariamente se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia, ella se caso a temprana edad y tiene una hija menor de edad la cual depende económicamente de ella y su esposo, ella no pudo estudiar a tiempo completo por falta de recursos económicos lo cual no le permitió terminar cursando hasta el cuarto grado de educación primaria, ella es una mujer dedicada a la agricultura y cultivo de café actividad que emprende junto a su esposo hace mas de ocho años, sus padres no pudieron educarla pero le enseñaron a ganarse la vida de una forma honrada, digna y responsable, en ocasiones reciben ayuda de parte del cuñado en el cultivo para el corte y recolección de café, sus cultivos están ubicados en la propiedad donde ellos viven en la parte de atrás de la casa lo cual les permite y les facilita dar el mantenimiento a su cultivo diariamente.

Blanca actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y pago del transporte de este producto hasta su vivienda, de esta forma poder obtener otros ingresos con la venta de este producto en la comunidad donde ella habita, y al mismo tiempo proteger su cultivo de las diferentes plagas que dañan este producto como lo es el café.

Su sueño es poder arreglar su casa y lograr darle a su hija lo que ella no pudo obtener, una educación escolar, colegial y universitaria que le permita tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, un mejor estilo de vida, y mas solvencia económica que le ayude a cubrir sus gastos y demás necesidades en su vida.
texts.en:
Blanca’s a tenacious, enterprising woman who strives daily to give her family the best.  She married young and has a minor daughter who depends economically on her and her husband.  She was unable to go to school full-time for lack of economic resources so she was only able to finish fourth grade in elementary school.  She’s a woman dedicated to agriculture and growing coffee, an activity she’s been doing alongside her husband for more than 8 years.  Her parents were unable to provide education for her but they did teach her how to earn a living honorably, properly and responsibly.  Her brother-in-law sometimes helps with the crops when it’s time to pick and harvest the coffee.  Her crops are located in the back of the same property where they live which makes caring for the crops daily easier.

Blanca is currently asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay to transport it to her house so she can earn extra income selling this product in the community where she lives while at the same time protecting her crops from the various infestations that can damage crops like coffee.

Her dream is to be able to fix her house and give her daughter what she was unable to have herself: a formal education including elementary, secondary and university so she’ll have better employment opportunities, a better lifestyle and more economic solvency to cover expenses and other life necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es:
Rodrigo de 48 años de edad es padre de 7 hijos. Su mayor pasión es su familia y por ella es que su trabajo vale la pena, por eso se esfuerza cada día para que el alimento no falte en casa. Desde hace seis años inició con la producción de arepas en el municipio de San Carlos, Colombia. Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para sostener su hogar y brindarle educación a sus hijos. Labora diariamente con su esposa y un hijo de 4 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde. 
Su nombre y producto ya son reconocidos en el municipio gracias a la calidad y el buen servicio. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de un fogón con chimenea a fin de mejorar el proceso de fabricación, reduciendo la mano de obra e incrementando la rentabilidad.

Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio y con ello mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 48 years old and has seven children. His greatest passion is his family. It is for them that his labor is worthwhile; it is for them that he puts in effort every day so that his household never lacks food.

Six years ago, he began making arepas (corn tortillas) in the municipality of San Carlos, Colombia. Due to the need to generate income to sustain his home and give his children an education, he works every day with his wife and one of his sons from 4 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. His name and product are already well-known in the community thanks to the quality and good service he offers. 

He is applying for a loan to buy a stove with a chimney in order to improve the process of making arepas. This will reduce labor costs and increase the profitability of his business.

His greatest dream is to grow his business and thus improve the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stove with a chimney.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, de 25 años es una mujer joven y seria. Vive en compañía de Paúl, junto con su madre y hermanas a las que quiere mucho y cuida en la casa donde nació. Estudió pedagogía en una universidad reconocida, hace poco terminó su carrera y espera poder desarrollar todos sus conocimientos. Su principal trabajo se centra en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió desde niña, ayudando a su mamá en los trabajo duros, de ahí aprendió todo lo necesario para poder desarrollar su trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos, los que le permitió pagar sus estudios y cuidar de su hijo pequeño. Ahora se encuentra en el cultivo de sus productos agrícolas como papa, maíz, alverja y sobre todo papa harinosa que es su especialidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Genoveva, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 25, is a serious young woman.  She lives in the company of Paul, her mother and sisters who she loves very much and cares for in the house she was born in.  She studied teaching at a well-known university and finished her career a short time ago and hopes to develop all her skills.  Her main work centers on agriculture, an occupation she learned since childhood helping her mother with the hard work.  There she learned everything necessary to be able to develop her work and improve her income which made it possible for her to pay for her studies and care for her young son.  Now, she’s growing her agricultural products like potatoes, corn, peas and especially starchy potatoes which are her specialty.

She belongs to the “Niño Jesús” communal bank and this is the third MFP loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity for progress and promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  She likes being a member of her association where all are united and supportive.  Genoveva will invest the money in the purchase of organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Emna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Emna de 26 años de edad,  originaria de la Comarca las Canoas, en la afueras de Teustepe, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 2 y 8 años, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio hace 2 años con préstamo que le hicieron  las instituciones financieras, y con ayuda de su marido quien también es comerciante el cual se dedica a vender gorras, anteojos de forma ambulante, ambos se ayudan en el negocio,  ella necesita agregar más productos a inventario para poder incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener ingresos extras.

Se acerca la temporada escolar en donde la demanda de sus artículos escolares crece y son muy solicitado por sus clientes, es por esta razón  que hoy está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar útiles escolares, como cuadernos lapiceros, borrador, regla, etc. Con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos y obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito, para luego volver a solicitar otro, unas de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene el negocio de pulpería.
texts.en:
Emna, 26, is from the Las Canoas district in the outskirts of Teustepe.  She’s the mother of two children aged between 2 and 8.  She’s a merchant and owns a general store.  She started it two years go with a loan she got from financial institutions and with help from her husband who is also a merchant selling caps and eyeglasses from place to place.  Both help each other out in the business.  She needs to add more products to the inventory in order to increase sales and earn extra income.

The school term is approaching and demand for school supplies grows; they are highly sought-after by her customers which is why she needs financing now to buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc. to increase income and earn higher profits.  Her future plan is to repay the loan in order to then request another one.  One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of the site where her general store is located.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 39 años de edad, ella no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres eran de muy bajos recursos pero con esfuerzo pudo cursar hasta el cuarto grado de educación primaria, ella es casada con 3 hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad y depende económicamente de ella y de su esposo, los otros dos son adultos, casados y tienen su propio hogar, ella es una mujer que se dedico desde muy pequeña a la agricultura ya que ese ha sido el único medio de ingreso para ella y su familia, hoy en día junto a su esposo siguen con la actividad que ha ayudado a cubrir las necesidades básicas en el hogar como la vestimenta, medicinas, alimentación, entre otras. Sus cultivos están ubicados a 500 metros de su casa de habitación hacia donde se trasladan a pie diariamente que ademas les permite cuidar y dar el mantenimiento necesario.

Hoy en día Mirian solicita ayuda para compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra para poder hacer un corte y recolección efectivo de su cultivo y poder vender un producto de calidad en el mercado local para que de esa forma pueda generar ingresos y seguir llevando alimento a su hogar.

Su sueño es lograr darle a su hijo un mejor futuro, un mejor estilo de vida logrando ahorrar para que el pueda estudiar y ser un hombre de provecho, que al mismo tiempo se pueda desempeñar en la sociedad y se pueda defender en la vida con sus estudios, y seguir mejorando cada día su estilo de vida como también ayudarle a sus padres con lo poco que ella obtiene de sus siembras.
texts.en:
Mirian is 39 years old. She was not able to study for long because her parents had a very low income, but with effort she studied up until the fourth grade of primary school. She is married with three children, of whom one is still a minor and depends on her and her husband financially. Her other two children are adults, married and living in their own houses.

She has made a living in agriculture since she was very young, as this has been the only way for her and her family to earn an income. Today, she and her husband continue with the same work, which has helped them to cover their basic home necessities such as clothing, medicine, and food, among others. Her crops are located 500 meters away from her house, and they walk to and from the field every day. This allows them to care for and maintain the crops.

Mirian is asking for help to buy fertilizer and pay the labor costs to cut and collect her crops. She will then be able to sell her good-quality product in the local market in order to earn an income and continue providing food for her home.

Her dream is to give her son a better future and a better lifestyle, so she manages to save for his studies so that he can become a useful man who can work and defend himself in life with his studies. She also hopes to continue improving her lifestyle every day and to help her parents with what little she earns from her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dúo San Vicente Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Vicente
Doña Verónica de 26 años e integra el dúo San Vicente, representando al grupo la señora Verónica quien se dedica a  la elaboración  y venta de servilletas, como también la venta de ropa típica, actividad con la que ella percibe ayuda económica para el sustento de sus dos hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de servilletas.
texts.en:
San Vicente Duo

Verónica, 26, is a member of the San Vicente duo and represents the group. She makes a living making and selling cloth napkins, as well as typical clothing. Through these activities, she receives financial help to support her two children. She is applying for a loan to buy materials to make the cloth napkins.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional woven fabrics (cloth napkins).

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN PABLO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chamarras, venta de mantas, venta de enaguas, venta de jugos, venta de guantes, tejido de chompas, tejido de chalinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de guantes y polainas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde la edad de 12 años (16 años de trabajo) aprendiendo este oficio de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The San Pablo Communal Bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Regional Office. The group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Angélica is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include the sale of food, jackets, blankets, petticoats, toys, and gloves, as well as knitting sweaters and scarves.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Angélica. She says that this is the first time she is working with Pro Mujer, which she joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. She has a business knitting gloves and leggings. She says that she learned about this business from her parents starting at the age of 12, so she has now been working for 16 years.

This loan will increase her working capital through the purchase of wool, which she will obtain from distributing companies. After making the products, she will sell them in the markets in the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate income to maintain her household as much as she can. She is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health workshops.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Las Heroinas Del Gas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS HEROINAS DEL GAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tejido a máquina, tejido de chompas, venta de sillones, venta de licuadoras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcelina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos electrónicos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigas y posteriormente ella decide realizar su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licuadoras) que adquirirá de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.

En la fotografía se identifica de blanco a la asesora Francisca que acompañó al grupo
texts.en:
The “Las Heroinas del Gas” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Marcelina.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are blanket weaving, machine knitting, sweater knitting, easy chair sales and blender sales.

The loan they are seeking will benefit small micro businesswomen like Marcelina.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited to join by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling electric appliances.  She states that she learned this business from her girlfriends and later decided to start her own venture.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy blenders in the city of Oruro and then sell them in her permanent stand in the city of El Alto.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home the best way possible since she lives in a free union and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training.  

In the photo, the group advisor, Francisca, accompanied the group and appears wearing white.

loans.use: to buy blenders.

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa, de 54 años es una mujer sencilla. Enviudó hace 29 años, desde entonces cuidó sola de sus 4 hijos, los que se encuentran formados y encaminados. Ahora ella vive sola en la casa que compró hace 30 años.  
En un principio sembraba y criaba animales como todas los campesinos, cuando falleció su esposo compró una casa en la plaza de la localidad, es ahí donde piensa en abrir una tienda de comestibles, pues no existía una en la zona, con el tiempo obtuvo muchas ganancias y incrementó la competencia, pero eso no la desmotivó pues tenía clientes fieles que nunca dejaron de comprar en su tienda. Con el paso del tiempo se consolidó y ahora es una de las más respetadas de la zona y muchos de sus habitantes comprar sus alimentos en su tienda. Ahora desea incrementar más su capital de trabajo para seguir cuidando de sus clientes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Santosa, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Santosa, 54, is a simple woman. She has been a widow for 29 years, and since then she has raised her four children by herself. They are now educated and on the right track in life. She currently lives alone in the house which she bought thirty years ago.

She used to plant crops and raise animals, like all of the other rural farmers. When her husband died, she bought a house in the plaza of her town. It was there that she had the idea to open a grocery store, because there were none in the area. Over time, she earned a good income. The competition increased, but that didn't discourage her because she had faithful clients who never stopped shopping in her store. With time, she consolidated her business and now she is one of the most respected businesswomen in the area. Many of the town's inhabitants do their shopping in her store. 

She would now like to increase her working capital in order to continue taking care of her clients. She belongs to the "Niño Jesús" communal bank, and this is her eighth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity to progress and she promises to make her payments on time. She also enjoys being a member of her association, where everyone is united and supportive.

Santosa will invest this money in the purchase of staple products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy staple products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс молодой парень в возрасте 29 лет.   Он женат имеет двоих детей. Он живет со своими родителями.  Пока не имеет возможности жить самостоятельно.  Фирдавс является   водителем  собственного микроавтобуса и развозит пассажиров по городу. Жена не где не работает только занимается воспитанием детей. У него очень тяжелая работа, он с раннего утра начинает работать и поздно вечером возвращается домой.  Дополнительный доход в семье от  его матери которая занимается торговлей женской одежды на рынке.  
Фирдавс хочет купить мягкую мебель для дома  и стиральную машину для матери. Он давно хочет обставить дом и долгое время копил деньги, сейчас ему немного не хватает, поэтому Фирдавс обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется получить нужную ему сумму и реализовать свой план. Заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young, 29-year-old man.  He's married and has two children.  He lives with his parents, and hasn't yet had the opportunity to live independently with his family.  Firdavs is the driver of his own mini-bus, and transports passengers throughout the city.  His wife does not work outside the home, and spends her time raising the children.  Firdavs' work is hard; he begins working early in the morning and returns home late.  The family has additional income coming from his mother, who sells women's clothing at a market.  Firdavs wants to buy furniture for his home and a washing machine for his mother.  He has long wanted to furnish his home, and has saved money over time. To cover what he lacks, Firdavs has turned to Arvand for financial assistance.  He hopes to receive the amount he needs to carry out his plan.  He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy furniture and a washing machine.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a tailor and she is a mother of two children. Both of them are students.

Humaira is a very hardworking and independent woman. She is a decorator. She makes many things which are used in the decoration of weddings. 

She is also an embroiderer and provides embroidery services in her community. She works very hard to provide for her family. She doesn't like to waste time, and she believes that time is money. 

Presently she is in need of purchasing a variety of thread and clothing for her embroidery business. For that, Humaira, as a member of a four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Humaira hopes that the loan will be a productive one for her family. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of thread and clothing for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sofía es miembro del  grupo Siempre Unidas de  S.M.P

La Sra. Sofía de 49 años es separada y tiene 02 hijos. En la actualidad vive con sus hijos uno de ellos es mayor de edad y trabaja. Sofía tiene un puesto en un mercado, donde se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, son 15 años que se dedica a la venta de estos productos; es por ello que tiene muchas clientas que año tras año son sus fieles compradoras, para poder mejorar su negocio ha solicitado su préstamo y con él podrá adquirir más  productos de belleza para  mejorar su negocio. Sofía esta agradecida por que gracias a sus préstamos ha mejorado mucho, así puede apoyar a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida, en el futuro desearía trasladar su negocio a un lugar más comercial donde pueda atender a más personas.
¡Sofía le agradece su apoyo! En la foto es la que viste color verde.
texts.en:
Sofía is a member of the group Siempre Unidas de S.M.P. 

Sofía is 49 years old, separated, and has two children. She currently lives with her children, one of whom is an adult and works. Sofía has a stall in a market where she makes her living selling beauty products. She has made a living selling these products for 15 years. That is why she has a lot of customers who remain her faithful consumers year after year. 

In order to improve her business she has requested a loan and with it she will be able to acquire more beauty products to enhance her business. Sofía is grateful because thanks to her loans she has improved a lot and this way she can support her children and give them a better quality of life. In the future she would like to move her business to a more commercial area where she can reach more people. 

Sofía thanks you for your support! She is the the woman dressed in green in the photo.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Karamatkhan

texts.ru: Караматхан 58 лет, замужем и имеет двух взрослых сыновей. Вместе с ними живет внук, внук учится в 7 классе. Караматхан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 1990 году. После развала СССР получили наделы земли, ведь колхозы были расформированы. Караматхан начала свой бизнес с 10,000 KGS. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Караматхан имеет очень развитое хозяйство. Также она выращивает картошку и фасоль, урожай Караматхан продает на местных рынках. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Караматхан  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади и 2 нетели на остаток средств планирует купить удобрения.
texts.en: Karamatkhan is 58 years old, married and has two adult sons.  Her grandson, who attends a seventh grade, lives together with them.  Karamatkhan started her business in animal husbandry and farming in 1990.  After the breakup of the USSR, she received a land plot because collective farms were dissolved.  Karamatkhan started her business with 10,000 KGS.  Today, she has a very well-developed business.  She also grows potatoes and beans and sells the harvest at local markets.  In order to further develop her business, Karamatkhan requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy a horse and two heifers, and fertilizers with the rest of the funds.

loans.use: to buy a horse and two heifers, and fertilizers

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.ru: Кымбат очень довольна результатами от первого кредита, Она благодарна людям которые поддержали её. Ежемесячные доходы Кымбат увеличились. Испытав пользу кредитов от КИВА, Кымбат обратилась в банк "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом 100,000 KGS на приобретение коров, для увеличения доходов от продажи молока.
texts.en: Kymbat is very pleased with the results of her first loan.  She is thankful to the people who supported her.  Her monthly income has now increased.  Having experienced the benefits of Kiva loans, she has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS.  She will use this new loan to purchase some cows in order to further increase her income from the sale of milk.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 30 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. По словам матери, дети и муж активно помогают по хозяйству. Индира в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 5,000 KGS сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Индира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи, сарай для скота.
texts.en: Indira is 30 years old, married and has four children.  According to her mother, the children and husband actively help with the business.  To provide an income for her family, Indira is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  Thanks to her hard work, the business allows her to bring in about 5,000 KGS per month, which serves the source for covering expenses for food and basic family needs.  In order to further develop her business, Indira requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase livestock headcount.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business in order to able to build a large house for her family and a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru:
С помощью КИВА Жылдызкан смогла увеличить свой ассортимент и клиенты этим очень довольны. Соответственно Жылдызкан смогла увеличить свои доходы. Он благодарна всем кто поддержал её. Поняв что количество товара в магазине увеличивают доходы, Жылдызкан обратилась в компанию "Бай Тушум и партнеры" за кредитом в 80,000 KGS. 
На приобретенные средства она собирается увеличить товарооборот в магазине.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan was able to expand her product assortment and make her customers very happy with the help of Kiva.  Therefore, she was also able to increase her income.  She is grateful to all, who supported her.  With the understanding that the quantity of merchandise at her store increases income, Jyldyzkan requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to increase product turnover at the store with these funds.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Sanjarbek

texts.ru: Санжарбеку 53 года, женат и воспитывают 4 детей. 3 дочери замужем младшая дочка школьница. Санжарбек имеет высшее образование, по характеру он спокойный и общительный.  Санжарбек, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, начал заниматься торговлей. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммой 5,000 KGS в 1997 году. Санжарбек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, приносящего на сегодняшний день прибыль в 12,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи продуктов питания. У Санжарбека имеется собственные магазин. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санжарбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения товарооборота. В будущем, Санжарбек планирует расширять магазин.
texts.en:
Sanjarbek is 53 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Three of his daughters are married, his youngest daughter is still in school.  Sanjarbek has a higher education and, by nature, he is quiet and sociable.

In search of an additional source of income, Sanjarbek has become involved in commerce.  He started his own business in 1997 with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  He put all his energy into the growth of his business and he is now making a monthly profit of 12,000 som (KGS) from the sale of food products.  He is the owner of his store.

In order to further develop his business, he has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), which will help him to increase his commodity turnover.  In the future, he is planning to increase the size of his store.

loans.use: to boost his inventory of food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida, de 30 años es una mujer sencilla, vive en compañía de su esposo Flavio con quien tiene 3 hijos: Anderson, Angely y Lidi, a los que cuida en la casa que alquila hace 5 años.  
Mientras que su esposo trabaja cortando leña para su venta, ella se dedica a la ganadería, posee cerdos, ovejas y vacas. Su trabajo consiste en ensebar a los animales para venderlos a un mayor precio, mientras que en las vacas, las utiliza para extraer leche y negociar todos los días a los lecheros de la zona. Durante las mañanas cuida de sus animales, ya por la tarde se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, maíz y habas, en terrenos alquilados y otros en asociación, pues su lema es “trabajar sin parar”. 
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Zaida, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más animales entre cerdos y ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Zaida is 30 years old and is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband Flavio with whom she has three children: Anderson, Angely and Lidy.  She cares for them in the house that she has rented for five years.  

While her husband works cutting wood for sale, Zaida works with livestock.  She owns pigs, sheep and cows.  Her work consists of fattening the animals in order to sell them at a better price.  With the cattle, she uses them for milk and she sells it every day to the milk men in the zone.  In the morning she cares for the animals, and in the afternoon she goes out to her fields of potato, corn, and beans. These are planted in rented fields and in others from the Association, since her motto is "work without ceasing."

She belongs to the communal bank "Baby Jesus" and this is her fifth credit with MFP.  She is thankful for the opportunity to make progress, and she promises to be punctual in her payments.  She enjoys belonging to this association, where everyone is united and supportive.  
  
Zaida will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of more animals like pigs and sheep, in order to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase more animals like pigs and sheep, in order to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Marcelino esta casado, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la atención de una tienda en general, venta de productos de consumo diario, inicio este negocio con un poquito de capital, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se dedica a los oficio domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que los utilizara para la compra de productos para su tienda: jugos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos, productos de embutidos, refrescos, y otros mas; espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas grande, tener su propia abarrotería con muchos cliente activos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelino, 40, is married, he finished elementary school and has two children, one of whom is studying. 

He owns a general store where he sells consumer products. He started this business with a little bit of capital. 

He has six years of experience. 

He depends on the support of his wife who takes care of the home. 

He is requesting a loan to buy products such as juice, candy, soda water, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks and more for his store. 

In the future he hopes to have a bigger business. He hopes to have his own grocery store with many customers.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga, de 46 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres.  Enfrenta los problemas de una manera sabia, no cuenta con una fábrica para la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas. Pero ello no fue un impedimento, pues alquilo uno, de esa manera comenzó a realizar ladrillos por ella misma y con ayuda de su esposo, realizan tejas y ladrillos por millares durante el mes, espera aumentar conforme avance el tiempo y adquieran más experiencia y sobre todo capital de trabajo. Sabe que lo logrará pues tiene éxito en la venta de los millares a los negociantes que lo visitan constantemente. Además cuenta que tiene terrenos agrícolas donde siembra alfalfa y los alquila  los ganaderos que buscan alimentos para su animales. Ahora desea comprar la tierra donde elabora los ladrillos y así no alquilarla.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “barrio oriental” y este es el crédito número 20 con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Dominga, invertirá el dinero en la compra de arenas, aserrín, por cantidades para la elaboración de ladrillos y arena.
texts.en:
Dominga is 46 years old and is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband and children in the house that she inherited from her parents.  She confronts problems in a wise manner.  She does not own a machine for making bricks and tiles.  But that was not an impediment.  She rented one and in that way began to make bricks herself and with her husband's help, she makes bricks and tiles by the thousands over the course of a month.  She hopes to increase productivity over time and with experience and above all with capital.  She knows that she will be successful because she has success selling the thousands to businessmen that visit constantly.  In addition, she notes that she has agricultural fields where she plants alfalfa and that are also rented to ranchers that need feed for their animals.  Now she wants to buy the land where she makes the bricks and thus not have to rent it.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Western neighborhood" and is with her 20th loan with MFP.  For this reason she is grateful for your support, by which she will reach her goals.  She also promises to repay her loan in a timely fashion.  She is happy to be part of the Association, since she has known the group for many years.  

Dominga will invest money in the purchase of sand and sawdust in large quantities for the making of bricks and tiles.

loans.use: To purchase sand and sawdust in large quantities for the making of bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo  de 35 años de edad, es cliente Kiva,  él se siente muy  agradecido con el préstamo Kiva, ya que le fue de gran ayuda porque lo pudo invertir en su negocio comprando productos de alta demanda tales como arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, avena, jabón, gaseosa, y pagar mano de obra para cubrir los costos de su siembra. Ya que cuando el no esta sembrando, se dedica  al negocio de pulpería. Es por eso que hoy en día está solicitando su tercer  financiamiento para comprar  productos nuevos  tales como  colcha, toallas, azúcar, pollo, papel higiénico, leche, aceite, etc. Con el propósito de  aumentar sus ingresos  para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Jairo is 35 years old and a Kiva borrower. He feels very thankful for the Kiva loan. It was a big help because he could invest it in his business, buying high-demand products like rice, sugar, sodas, oats, soap, and pay for the labor costs of sowing the land. When he is not sowing, he is working in his business of the local convenience store. It is for that reason that today he is applying for his third loan in order to buy new products like bedspreads, towels, sugar, chicken, toilet paper, milk, oil, etc, with the intention of increasing his income in order to give a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy new products like bedspreads, towels, sugar, chicken, toilet paper, milk, oil, etc

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
el señor Armando esta casado, tiene 51 a{os de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene un hijo el cual aun no estudia, se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente al tricotado de hilos y a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio siendo empleado, hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuenta con  el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica alos oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hijos, para aumentar su producción de tricotados de hilos en varios diseños, espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio y con capital propio, con varios empleados trabajando.
texts.en:
Armando is married and 51 years old. He finished his primary education, and has a son who is no longer in school. He works making handicrafts, specifically knitting and weaving. He started this work as an employee, and up until now he has 18 years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who does the housework. 

He is requesting a loan that he will use to purchase thread, in order to increase his production of weavings in various designs. He hopes in the future to have a broad business with his own capital, with various employees working.

loans.use: to buy material to make clothing.

loans.name: Japhet's Group

texts.en: Japhet is a 51-year-old farmer and father of five. His wife is also a drylands farmer. Japhet grows maize, cassava and cashew nuts. Challenges to his agricultural endeavors include drought or unreliable rains and crop diseases and pests. Japhet joined the KOMAZA microforestry program to improve his farming know-how and increase his income from KOMAZA tree sales. He recognizes the various benefits of tree farming: "The trees attract rains or improve the environment. Tree sales will help meet basic needs, housing, health, education and clothing." Japhet intends to use his income from the farm for his family's education and to improve his farming.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is engaged in a fruits and vegetables trade. She rents a place in one of Sevan City's shops where she runs her small business. Hasmik’s husband helps her to transfer vegetables and fruits, which she buys in wholesale markets, using his own car. Hasmik has a higher economics education – she is an accountant – and this fact helps Hasmik in her business. During the Soviet period for over 20 years, she worked as an accountant. But after the Soviet system destroyed many enterprises, Hasmik became unemployed. That’s why she decided to run her own business. 

Now Hasmik has a lot of clients, and not only from her area in Sevan City. Many people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from shining Hasmik. She likes her activity and does it with great pleasure, because, as she says, trading is hard but at the same time is a very profitable business.

Hasmik is married and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in Sevan City. All of them are unemployed and they are engaged in farming. Hasmik is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables for reselling in her shop. This loan will help Hasmik to enlarge her goods assortment and to receive more profit from her trading.

loans.use: to enlarge her goods assortment and to receive more profit from her trading

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en: Marthaline is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, that has the largest free port and is the #1 commercial county in Liberia. She is single with four children between 5 months and 12 years old, that are in school and live at home. She has been selling dry fish for the past three years. Marthaline started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Ana Doneyda

texts.es:
Ana Doneyda de 27 años  de edad, casada con dos hijos de 3, 7 anos. Es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta pasar tiempo de calidad compartiendo con sus hijos en el parque. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económica. Pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar trabajo social.

Gracia a su espritud de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace tres anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. El cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar y un lote de cerdos que se lo dan a buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos.  Ana Doneyda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ana Doneyda is 27, married with two children, ages three and seven.  She is originally from Malpaisillo, place located in the Southwest part of the country.  During her free time she likes to spend quality time with her children at the park. Unfortunately she wasn't able to go to university because she didn't have the financial resources.  However, she would have very much liked to study social work.

Thanks to her getting ahead attitude, she has an economic activity raising and selling pigs, three years ago she started working in this activity. She manages the business from her home.  The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and buy a lot of pigs that were offered to her at a good price.  This way in the short future she will get better income.  Ana Doneyda is thankful for the help the kiva investors provide to people with low resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua, to obtain a dignified work activity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by buying pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Imperial, caracterizada por su clima variado, sus playas hermosas y su agricultura, vive Israel, un joven de 20 años de edad, con un carisma muy contagiante y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven Israel aprendió a trabajar, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Con cada amanecer Israel se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a su centro de labores ya que él trabaja en una empresa naturista de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de hogar.

Israel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando el podrá realizar la reparación y mantenimiento de su pequeña moto, ya que actualmente está en mal estado y por ello no tiene como movilizarse a su centro de labores el cual se encuentra en una zona alejada, así el podrá llegar puntualmente y podrá ahorrar dinero, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de Agronomía”.
texts.en:
In the city of Imperial, characterized by its varied climate, beautiful beaches and agriculture, lives Israel, a twenty year old young man with contagious charisma and a desire to succeed.  Since he was very young, Israel learned to work because his parents had few economic resources.  It is because of this that he only attended school through the fifth grade.  

Each morning Israel wakes up very early to go to work in a naturist company in the city.  He works about nine hours per day and this allows him to help his parents with their living expenses.  

Israel is very grateful for Kiva loans because they allow him to repair and maintain his small, broken down motorcycle in order to go to work in a distant part of the city.  He will now be able to arrive to work on time and save money so he can continue to work towards realizing his biggest dream: to get a degree in Agriculture.

loans.use: to repair and maintenance his motorcycle.

loans.name: Pamela De La Flor

texts.es:
Pamela tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se encuentran playas hermosas. Pamela trabaja como secretaria en una institución de su ciudad, y es que ella apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar con el fruto de su trabajo, por ello dia a dia se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a su centro de labores; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Pamela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, mayólicas, canaletas, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y así poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder estudiar la carrera de administración y ayudar a su familia".
texts.en:
Pamela is 21 years old and lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for having a very warm and welcoming climate. This area also has beautiful beaches. Pamela works as a secretary at an institution in the city. Using the earnings from her job, she is able to help her family with the household expenses. Pamela wakes up very early each day so that she can leave for her workplace. She believes that she is moving forward because she is responsible and enjoys what she does.

Pamela is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, tiles, gutters, and other items for making improvements to her home. This will allow Pamela to provide her family a better quality of life. She continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of studying for a Management degree so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Hentee

texts.en: Hentee is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with an 8-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She has been selling used clothes for the past 2 years. She started this business from her susu (local saving accounts) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In the future she wants to own a house. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 41 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between 12 and 26. They are in school and live at home. She has been selling charcoal since 2004.  She started this business with a loan that she took from a club (group saving accounts) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. In future, she wants to educate her children and build a house. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret used the previous loan to buy manure to boost the fertility of the soil to increase production.She is 45 and married with seven children. Three of her children are below 18 years of age. She lives in her own house located in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and has been farming for ten years. This has enabled her to buy more land and also start to build a new residential house. However, she is constrained by the climate change, which is causing uncertain seasons and prolonged dry seasons that lead to low yields. Her family dream is to increase her household's income level and her business dream is to become the leading farmer in the area. Margret intends to use this loan to buy paint and cement to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement to complete her house.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Ligia María de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, originaria de León Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con sus amigas en el cine siempre con alguna diversión sana. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos. Por lo que se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad ayudando a su mama con la venta de queso. Pero le hubiera gustado ser una profesional.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de queso, desde hace dos anos que se independizo con el negocio, y lo realiza de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Ligia es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto a clientes fijos y eventuales. El negocio consiste en vender diferentes tipos de queso como: queso fresco, queso quesillo, queso duro, queso asado, queso ahumado. El crédito lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Ligia María Agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ligia María is 25 years old, single, and without children.  She is originally from León, which is located in the western part of the country.  In her free time, she likes to have fun with her friends at the movie theater or doing some other healthy activity.  Unfortunately, she couldn't go to college due to financial difficulties, but she would have liked to be some kind of professional.  She was obliged from an early age to work helping her mother at her cheese shop.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she has work in selling cheese.  She became took over the business two years ago and is a street vendor.  Ligia's daily routine includes working 8 hours a day offering her goods to customers (both new and regular).  The business involves selling different types of cheese, including queso fresco ("fresh cheese"), queso quesillo ("soft cheese"), queso duro ("hard cheese"), queso asado ("grilled cheese"), and queso ahumado ("smoked cheese").

She needs this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business in order to raise her level of income in the not-to-distant future.  Ligia María is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders offer those with limited resources and who live in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they might have sources of legitimate work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock her cheese shop with products such as queso fresco ("fresh cheese"), queso quesillo ("soft cheese"), queso duro ("hard cheese"), queso asado ("grilled cheese"), and queso ahumado ("smoked cheese").

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is 36 years old and lives Montserrado County, which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between 3 to 18 years old; they are in school and live at home. She has been operating a restaurant for the past ten years. She started this business thorough the help of her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part of her business is that every day she can finish on time, and she makes lots of profit. She is requesting this loan to purchase more coal, rice, onions, peppers, and oil for her business. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, rice, onions, peppers, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El señor Andrés un humilde campesino, de 66 años de edad,  originario de la Comarca llamada la Laguna,  en las afueras de Boaco, padres de 8 hijos mayores de edad, casado, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, actividad que realiza hace más de 20 años en tierras que con mucho esfuerzo propio y arduo trabajo fue adquiriendo poco a poco, además tiene sus vaquitas que ha ido comprando con los ingresos  de la cosecha  y dinero que le dan sus hijos. Andrés realiza su trabajo con ayuda de sus hijos  y mano de obra de otras personas que contrata por temporada.  La cosecha la lleva a vender a Managua en donde le pagan a un buen precio el grano básico. En esta ocasión está solicitando el crédito para  pagar mano d obra  y comprar dos vacas  y todos los insumos necesarios para su siembra  como fertilizantes, abonos  para el siguiente ciclo de su cosecha.
texts.en: Andrés is a humble farmer, 66 years old, originally from the region called La Laguna, in the outskirts of Boaco.  He has 8 adult children and is married.  He plants corn and beans, an activity which he has been doing for more than 20 years on land that he has acquired bit by bit through his own effort and hard work.  He also has cows that he has purchased with income from his crops and money from his children.  Andres does his work with help from his children, and with labor that he contracts for the season.  He takes his crops to Managua to sell where he receives a good price for basic grains.  He is requesting a loan to pay for labor and to purchase two cows and all supplies he needs for planting, such as fertilizers for the next crop cycle..

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase two cows and all the materials necessary for planting such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el  grupo Jóvenes Emprendedores

Carmen Luz es una de las socias del grupo, ella  tiene 46 años, es separada con 02 hijos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a tejer ropa de invierno chompas, chalinas y gorras. Empezó este negocio hace 06 años, lo aprendió por medio de unas amigas que se dedican  a lo mismo, los fines de semana se dedica  a la venta de bebidas en un parque cercano a su casa, gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando,  el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas para este verano; ya que desea incrementar este negocio por la demanda que tiene. Carmen Luz se siente muy feliz por todo lo que ha logrado y más adelante desearía dejar de vender en la calle y tener un local propio para la venta de bebidas.
Carmen Luz está muy agradecida por su préstamo  a los Inversionistas de KIVA que hacen posible que ella y su grupo comunal puedan obtener sus préstamos, en la foto ella es la cuarta de la izquierda esta vestida con polo a rayas plomo con morado.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú! This is the group Young Entrepreneurs.

Carmen Luz is one of the group members. She is 46, separated and has two grown children. She knits winter sweaters, scarves and hats. She started this business 6 years ago, learning from one of her friends who does it. On the weekends she sells drinks in a park near her house. Thanks to her work she has been able to help her kids so that they can continue their studies.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of drinks for the summer, since she wants to increase this business to meet her demand. Carmen Luz feels very happy about everything she has achieved, and in the future would like to stop selling on the street and have a store of her own to sell drinks. Carmen Luz is very grateful for the loan and for the Kiva investors, who make it possible for her and her group to get their loans.

In the photo she is the fourth from left, in a striped gray and pink t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
