Maria es mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy humilde de 33 años de edad, casada con un hogar integrado por cinco hijos dedicada desde muy pequeña a la agricultura en la siembra de papas siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron el oficio, ella tiene un grado de escolaridad primario cursado hasta el quinto grado pero no pudieron seguirla apoyando por la falta de dinero; pero le enseñaron como trabajar la tierra y gracias a ello tiene a tres de sus hijos en la escuela, los cuales después de salir de sus actividades escolares ayudan en algunas labores para la preparación de la tierra, siembra y cultivo de papa.

Maria actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes y para el pago de mano de obra ya que a diario busca la forma de poder salir adelante, para ellos la agricultura es el único medio de ingreso lo que les permite poder cubrir con la canasta básica y demás gastos familiares como ser estudio, medicina, vestimenta, ellos para poder ver mejores resultados en cuanto a ingresos trabajan los dos, de esa manera, se evitan pagar más personas esto les ayuda a que cuando recogen la cosecha les genera un poco mas de ingresos para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos ya que ellos a medida van creciendo se presentan mayores necesidades de estudio y salud, etc.

Maria es una señora con mucha voluntad de salir adelante eso le ha permitido tener un objetivo que es ayudar a su esposo y sus hijos a salir adelante como también mantener un buen record en la cooperativa para seguir gozando de los beneficios que da; pero su mayor sueño es hacer de sus hijos hombres y mujeres de provecho, graduados en su secundaria y en la universidad para que puedan defenderse en la vida y tengan mejores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Maria is a fighter, hardworking and very humble.  She is 33 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She has worked in agriculture growing potatoes since she was very young, as she learned this work from her parents. She completed school through the 5th grade but was not able to continue due to a lack of money. Nevertheless her parents taught her to work the land and thanks to that she has three of her children in school.  When they finish their school activities they help with some of the work preparing the land, planting, and harvesting the potatoes.  

Maria is currently requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.  Every day she is looking for a way to get ahead.  For her family agriculture is the only means of income that lets them meet their basic needs and cover family expenses such as schooling, medicine, and clothing.  They have better results in terms of income when both adults are working.  Then they do not have to pay others to help them harvest the crop and can keep more income to provide their children with a better quality of life. As their children grow up they have greater needs in terms of education and health, etc. 

Maria is a woman with a strong will to get ahead and this has allowed her to have the goal of helping her husband and children succeed. She has also maintained a good record in the communal bank in order to continue enjoying the benefits that it provides.  Her greatest dream is for her children to grow up to be successful men and women who complete high school and attend university so that they can do well in life and have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor to plant and harvest potatoes.

loans.name: Olga Elena

texts.es:
Olga Elena de 32 años de edad, casada con  un hijo menor de seis anos,  originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país,  en sus ratos libres le gusta pasar tiempo de calidad con su hijo. Lamentablemente para Olga no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económica, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar trabajo social.
 Gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de superación personal es  que tiene por actividad la venta de mercadería en general como cosméticos, perfumes, pantalones, short, vestidos, ropa interior prenda de oro y plata. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante y en su casa de  habitación. Ofreciendo a sus  clientes fijos y eventuales. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Olga Elena agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Olga is 32 years old, married and has a 6-year-old son. She is a native of Leon, which is located in the western part of Nicaragua. In her free time she likes to spend quality time with her son. Sadly for Olga, she wasn't able to go for a college degree because of a lack of economic resources, but she would really like to study social work. Thanks to her hard work and her desire to move up in life she has a business selling general merchandise like cosmetics, perfumes, pants, shorts, dresses, underwear and garments of gold and silver. She sells on the street and at her home and has regular customers. She enjoys her work because it has supported herself and her family. She plans to use the loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business with merchandise so in the not-too-distant future she will earn more income. Olga is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, pants, shorts, dress and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty, de 28 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Wilmer, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Dany y Jefri a los que cuida y aman mucho, en la casa que heredó hace 16 años. 
Ella es una mujer fuerte, a diferencia de los demás es la primera mujer que trabaja en la construcción de carreteras. Se siente satisfecha, sobre todo porque obtiene un ingreso extra y puede ayudara a su esposo, quien es músico y  toca en diferentes eventos de la localidad. “Toco música típica”, afirma. Ya en sus tiempos libres, aprovecha para poder ayudar a su esposa en el cuidado de sus sembríos y de sus vacas, ovejas y vaquillonas. Pues saben que tiene clientes que siempre comprar sus productos, además de disfrutar su estadía en el campo. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo, ahora están a punto de adquirir los papeles de su casa, con lo que será suya legalmente, además de haber comprado varios terrenos agrícolas para poder sembrar. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “La rosa de paltarumi” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada.
Ketty de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ketty, age 28, is a hardworking young woman. She lives with her husband Wilmer and their two children, Dany and Jefri, who they care for and love dearly. They live in a house that she inherited 16 years ago.

Ketty is a strong woman who is different from others because she is one of the first to work in highway construction. She is very pleased about this because she is able to earn an extra income and help her husband, who is a musician who plays at different events in their town. “He plays folk music,” confirms Ketty. She takes advantage of her free time to help her husband with growing crops and raising cows, sheep, and heifers. They know that they have customers who will always buy their products. Ketty and her husband also enjoy spending time in the fields. Thanks to their efforts, she says that they were able to file the papers for their house that shows legal ownership. They also bought several plots of farmland for planting.

Ketty is a member of the Communal Bank “La Rosa de Paltarumi” and this is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very pleased that she can develop her business activities as normal, thanks to the support of the Kiva lenders. Ketty also promises to handle all of her payments in a timely manner since she has always been a responsible and honest person. By receiving this loan, she will invest the money she requested in the purchase organic compost that she can apply on her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost for her crops.

loans.name: Georgina Ancelma

texts.es:
Georgina de 57 años de edad, casada con hijos adultos e independientes. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Georgina de caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente Georgina no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos. Pero lo hubiera gustado mucho ser Abogado. 
Gracias a su espiritud e emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica prestar servicios de mantenimiento en los cementerios, y elaborar losetas, cruces. Tiene 34 años de  trabajar en dicha actividad. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es compra materia prima para la elaboración de locetas y cruces,  como cerámica, cemento, hierro, arena, madera clavos. Georgina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Georgina is 57 years old, married and has grown-up children. She is a native of Leon, which is located in the western part of Nicaragua. She is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman, and has demonstrated that in her previous loans. Sadly, Georgina wasn't able to study for a college degree because of a lack of economic resources, but she would have really liked to have been a lawyer. Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her desire to make headway, she has made a living maintaining a cemetery and making tombstones and crosses for the past 34 years. She really enjoys her work because it has provided for her and her family. She plans to use the loan to purchase materials to make the tombstones and crosses, such as ceramics, cement, iron, sand and wooden nails. Georgina is grateful for Kiva lenders who provide people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua a means to a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase ceramics, cement, iron, sand and wooden nails.

loans.name: Fernando Josue

texts.es:
El joven Fernando Josue esta soltero, tiene 18 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación diversificada, se dedica a prestar los servicios de transporte publico, inicio este negocio, siendo ayudante de chofer, como empleado, hasta el momento leva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que  lo utilizara para la compra de un juego de 4 llantas para su vehículo, ya  que quiere brindar un buen servicio  a sus clientes, esperando en el futuro tener una flota de vehículo, prestando el mejor servicio, y así mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Fernando is single, 18 years old and attended school. He makes a living providing transportation services. He started the business after he worked as an assistant driver, and at the moment he has three years of experience. He is requesting the loan to purchase a set of four tires for his vehicle, since he wants to provide his customers with a better service. He hopes in the future to have a fleet of vehicles and provide the best service, and in this way improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: David Karanja

texts.en:
David still does his farming activity, which is doing so well. He plants carrots and potatoes, and this produce always has a ready market.  

He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, David hopes to practice mixed farming, thereby diversifying his sources of income.

loans.use: To buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Solomie

texts.en:
Solomie is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport harbor and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with three children between 4 and 15 years old who are attending school and live at home.  

She has been selling dried fish for the past seven years. She says her main challenge is the transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money, and what makes her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children and herself. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more dried fish to expand her sales. She plans to build a house for children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to expand her sales.

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladys del Carmen de  40 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 13,21 anos, ellos estudian en la universidad y en secundaria. Ella es originaria de León. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Gladys se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, lo cual lo ha demostrado en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Y su prioridad es ayudar a sus hijos que superen en la vida. Para que sean hombre de bien.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica venta de repostería y piza,( cachos,rin,pasteles,donas,maletas,tortas de pasa,) desde hace siete años que se dedica al negocio. Y está ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina de trabajo es unas 10 horas diaria ofreciendo su producto y con mayor demanda los fines de semana. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano aumentar sus ingresos. Gladys del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gladys del Carmen is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 21.  They are in high school and college, respectively.  She is originally from León, which is located in the western part of the country. Gladys is a hardworking and responsible woman, which has demonstrated by making her payments on time.  Unfortunately she could not attend school due to a lack of financial resources.  Her priority is to help her children get ahead in life so that they are successful adults.  Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead she has had a business selling pastries (cream horns, pastries, donuts, savory "suitcase pies", raisin cakes) and pizza for 6 years.  The business is located in her home.  She works 10 hours a day offering her products and has higher demand on the weekends.  The loan will be used for working capital and to stock her business so that in the near future she will be able to increase her income.  
Gladys del Carmen is thankful for the assistance that the Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have an opportunity to obtain decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business selling pastries such as cream horns, pastries, donuts, savory "suitcase"pies, raisin cake, and pizza.

loans.name: Filimon

texts.es:
Filimon de 55 años de edad,  soltero con un hijo mayor, e independiente, originario de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo cual no pudo cursar sus estudios básicos.
Gracias a su espíritu de superación personal es que tiene por actividad económica el servicio de radio técnico, desde hace nueve años. En un lugar especifico de la localidad. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de trabajo es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo invertir en repuesto de radio y televisión como: cables, transistores, parlantes, tubos, pantallas, tornillos, pega. Filimon agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Filimon is 55 years old.  He is single with and adult son who lives on his own.  He is originally from Achuapa, located in the northern part of the country.  He is a responsible and hardworking man interested in self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he had to start working very young in order to help with household expenses and therefore could not complete primary school.  

Thanks so his spirit of continuous self-improvement he has had a business fixing radios for 9 years.  He has a shop in town.  He enjoys this work very much as it has been his livelihood and that of his family.  He works 10 hours a day offering services to both regular and occasional clients.  The loan will be used as working capital to purchase replacement parts for televisions and radios such as cables, transistors, speakers, tubes, screens, screws, and glue.  Filimon is thankful for the assistance that the Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have an opportunity to obtain decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for radio and television replacement parts such as cables, transistors, speakers, tubes, screens, screws, glue.

loans.name: Eugenia Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia Victoria esta soltera, tienen 19 años de edad, cursó los grado de educación secundaria, se dedica al comercio a la atención de una tienda en general, inicio este negocio teniendo un poco de capital, y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos, para su tienda de consumo diario, compra de jugos, aguas gaseosas, golosinas, azúcar, frijol, arroz, cereales, etc; espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio y prospero, con capital propio.
texts.en:
Eugenia Victoria is 19 years old and single.  She received a secondary education and earns an income running a general store which she began three years ago with just a little capital.

She is requesting a loan to buy daily consumption products for her store such as juices, sodas, sweets, sugar, beans, rice, cereals, etc.  Her goal for the future is to expand her business and prosper, with her own capital.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Kevin Gabriel

texts.es:
En la alegre y cálida ciudad de Chincha, caracterizada por su variada gastronomía playas hermosas y la alegría de sus pobladores, vive Kevin un joven de 19 años de edad que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que su familia humilde y de pocos recursos económicos y que a pesar de los obstáculos por los cuales atraviesa, es estudiante de la carrera de Medicina Veterinaria  ya que le gusta mucho los animales y para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios él trabaja en una parroquia de su ciudad; Kevin trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día, el cree que está saliendo adelante ya que es muy responsable y sobre todo desea ser el orgullo de su familia.

Kevin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como esteras, palos, cañas, ya que podrá  techar un pequeño cuarto en el cual el podrá habitar ya que el cuarto donde habitaba tiene muchas rajaduras en las paredes y ya no se puede habitar, así el tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder construir la vivienda de sus padres de material noble y ser un gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Kevin, 19, lives in the happy and warm city of Chincha, known for its varied gastronomy, beautiful beaches and happiness of its people.  He is able to get ahead with much effort as his family is humble with scarce economic resources.  Despite the obstacles he is up against, he is a student of veterinary medicine and love animals.  To cover his education expenses he works at a parish in the city about five hours a day.  He believes he is doing well because he is responsible and wants his family to be proud of him.

Kevin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he is able to buy construction materials such as matting, wood and cane so he can put the roof on a small room where he plans to live.  The one he is in now is not in very good condition.  This will give him a better quality of life so he can continue toward his goal: "To build a home out of stone for his parents and become a good professional".

loans.use: To buy roofing materials.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
El  banco comunal las Marías está conformado por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre, personas responsables padres de familia, con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. Y se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche, cuajada, queso. Estas personas son responsables, trabajadoras, lo han demostrado en sus créditos anteriores  en su forma de pagos en tiempo y forma.
Gracias a su espíritu y ganas de salir adelante tiene diferentes actividades económicas. María Angélica es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. La rutina de trabajo de Angélica es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias, con una pana en su cabeza de unos 20 kg ofreciendo sus cuajadas a los pobladores de su localidad. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. el objetivo del credito es invertir en capiitla de trabajo y surtir su negocio. para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal las Marías agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank LAS MARÍAS is comprised of nine members, eight women and a man, who are responsible heads of family with a total of 15 children in their care.  They are from Sauce which is located in the northern part of the country and known for its milk, cottage cheese and cheese.  These are responsible, hard-working people who have paid back their previous loans on time.

Thanks to their spirit and determination to get ahead, they are involved in different business activities.  María Angélica is the coordinator of the group and earns an income selling cottage cheese at home and as a street vendor.  Her work routine involves ten hours a day of work wearing a 20 kg bundle on her head offering cottage cheese to people in her village.  She enjoys her work as this is how she earns a living for her family.  The aim of the loan is to buy more goods to sell so she can improve her income.  The communal bank LAS MARÍAS is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help in poor countries such as Nicaragua, to low income earners so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy cottage cheese to sell.

loans.name: Katherine Lisbeth

texts.es:
Katherine es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad con playas hermosas un clima cálido y sobre todo podemos encontrar muchos atractivos turísticos como las “islas Ballestas”. Katherine es una joven que ha pasado por varios momentos difíciles, especialmente debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria.

Cada día Katherine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, al cual le dedica alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el cual puede apoyar en con los gastos; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y es responsable.

Katherine está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como labiales, sombras, cremas, entre otros, de esta manera podrá  tener variedad productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un auto para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Katherine is 20 years old and lives in the city of Pisco, a place with beautiful beaches, a warm climate and, especially, many tourist attractions such as the "Islas Ballestas" (Ballestas Islands).  Katherine has had many difficult moments in her life, due mainly to a lack of resources.  Therefore, she was only able to study up to fifth grade of secondary school.

Every day, Katherine works in her small business selling cosmetics.  She spends about eight hours a day on the job so she can cover her expenses.  She believes she is getting ahead thanks to the fact that she works hard and is responsible.

Katherine is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to them, she can buy merchandise for her business such as lipstick, eye shadow, creams, etc.  This allows her to offer a variety of products to her customers so she can continue toward her goal:  "To have a a car for her business activity.".

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jairo Johanan

texts.es: Jairo de 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como ama de casa y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Jairo es una persona responsable y trabajadora que cuenta con grandes sueños y anhelos de salir adelante junto a su familia y así también contar con un hogar estable y feliz. Jairo posee una carpintería en la que se dedica a hacer puertas, muebles, sillas, estantes, mesas y todo lo que el cliente le solicite elaborar, ya cuenta con varios años de tener su negocio lo que le permite ser muy conocido en la zona y así mismo ser recomendado entre conocidos, debido a su excelente trabajo y dedicación. Jairo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de chapas para puertas, madera, pintura, pegamento y otros artículos más que le permitan aceptar más trabajo y de esta manera mejorar notoriamente sus ganancias y al mismo tiempo mejorar su negocio, equipándolo con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jairo is 33 and lives with his wife, a homemaker, and their three minor children.  Jairo is a very responsible, hard-working person with many goals and a desire to get ahead with his family, to have a stable home and be happy.  Jairo is a carpenter and makes doors, furniture, chairs, shelving, tables and anything a customer might order. He has a lot of experience, is very well-known in the area and his acquaintances recommend his work because of the excellent quality and craftsmanship.  

Jairo is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy paneling, wood, paint, glue and other supplies necessary to take in more orders.  This will increase his income considerably while also improving the business by having more materials on hand.

loans.use: To buy wood, paint and glue for his business.

loans.name: Oliberto

texts.es: Oliberto de 31 años de edad, es un padre muy trabajador quien siempre está luchando por su familia que está conformada por su esposa y tres hijos. Oliberto trabaja vendiendo vitaminas, las cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación y donde su esposa e hijos le ayudan, así mismo él vende de forma ambulante en plazas, mercados, colonias y autobuses donde las ofrece a todos los pasajeros, esto le ayuda mucho a mejorar sus ganancias. Oliberto es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias ya que es responsable y trabajador. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor variedad de vitaminas, así mismo para comprar algunas medicinas naturales las cuales tienen mucha demanda. Oliberto se esfuerza mucho a diario por llevar el sustento a su casa, lo que desea mejorar  y de esta forma contar con una vida mejor junto a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en: Oliberto is 31 years old. He is a very hardworking father who is always fighting for his family, made up of his wife and three children. Oliberto works selling vitamins from his house, where his wife and children help him. He also sells as a street vendor in the plazas, markets, neighborhoods and buses, where he offers them to all the passengers. This helps him to improve his earnings. Oliberto is a person who has good references because he is responsible and hardworking. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. With it, he can buy a bigger quantity of vitamins as well as buy some natural vitamins which are high in demand. Oliberto works hard every day to support his home. What he wants is to improve and have a better life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and natural medicine to sell.

loans.name: Giovana Patricia

texts.es:
Giovana es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de las adversidades ella lucha cada día para poder mejorar. La vivienda de Giovana se encuentra en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad con un clima muy cálido y acogedor, así como también se encuentran muchas playas, las cuales son muy visitadas por los turistas durante todo el año. Dia a día Giovana trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un pequeño restaurante de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y tiene muy buena sazón para la cocina.

Giovana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder realizar mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres, especialmente construir un cerco para la vivienda y mejorar la fachada, de esta manera podrá tener mayor seguridad en su vivienda y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Estudiar la carrera de gastronomía y ser una gran chef”.
texts.en:
Giovana is a woman with a strong will to get ahead in life. Despite of the difficulties she faces, she keeps fighting to improve every day. Giovana lives in the city of Pisco, a city with a warm and cozy climate and beaches that are popular with tourists.

Giovana works as a kitchen assistant in a small restaurant. She works around ten hours per day and with the fruits of her labor she can help her parents with the home expenses. She believes she is successful because she is responsible and is a good cook.

Giovana appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give her, because she will be able to buy materials to improve her parents’ house. In particular, she wants to build a fence and improve the front of the house, which will result in better safety conditions. She will continue pursuing her biggest dream: “to study gastronomy and become a great chef.”

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Elba Jalec

texts.es: Elba de 39 años de edad habita junto a su feliz familia en su humilde hogar. Es una mujer con muchas aspiraciones y deseos de superación, atenta, amable y responsable con lo que mejor sabe hacer que es entregarle alegría y felicidad a su familia. Elba se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y jocote y realiza esta actividad desde hace tiempo esa es la manea de cómo se gana la vida y gracias a Dios jamás le ha faltado nada y con esfuerzo hace que sus hijos no les falte nada y se esfuercen por todo el trabajo que su madre hace para brindarles lo mejor. La cliente desea comprar insumos agrícolas para sus próximas cosechas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes entre otros. Desea tener el crédito pues no cuenta con otra fuente de ingreso y es muy comprometida con las deudas que adquiere, ella lo único que desea es que sus hijos sigan teniendo una buena vida y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Elba, 39, lives in a humble house together with her joyful family. She is a woman with many aspirations and a strong will to improve. She is attentive, kind and responsible and she focuses in what she does best: giving her family happiness and joy.

Elba grows corn, beans and a type of plum called “jocote”. She has been doing this for some time now and this is how she makes a living. God has always provided for her and with her effort, she makes sure her children have everything they need and they recognize what she does for them. 

Elba wants to buy agricultural supplies for the upcoming seasons and that is why she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL in order to buy seeds, compost and fertilizers among other things. She hopes to receive the loan since she has no additional sources of income and she is responsible with the debts she acquires. The only thing she wants is that her children continue to have a good life and that they have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es: José vive junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo que se dedica a trabajar. José se dedica a la elaboración de tostadas de yuca y plátano, las cuales también comercializa en su casa, de forma ambulante en colegios, escuelas, centros de trabajo, en diferentes colonias y así mismo en autobuses. Al mismo tiempo se dedica a la siembra de maíz junto a su esposa y posteriormente vende en almacenes de granos básicos y mercados, todo esto se suma en un esfuerzo realizado por su parte para sostener su hogar y brindar el sustento diario, estudios, ropa y todo lo necesario a su familia. José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de yuca y plátanos para elaborar las tostadas y así mismo para comprar semillas de maíz para sembrar, pesticidas y rociadores para cuidar al máximo su cultivo, con lo que José podrá mejorar su negocio y su cultivo de manera que brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: José lives with his life's companion and his young son. Jose works, He makes toasted yucca and plantains, which he sells from his house and as a street vendor in high schools, primary schools, workplaces, and in different neighborhoods and on busses. He also grows corn with his wife and later sells in basic grain stores and markets. All of this is added together as an effort to support his home and pay for the daily expenses, the studies, clothing and everything his family needs. José is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, which he will use to invest in buying yucca and plantains as well as buy corn seeds to plant and pesticides and sprayers to care for his crops. This way, José will be able to improve his business and crop i order to offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to toast and sell.

loans.name: Payazbek

texts.ru: Паязбеку  52 года, женат и воспитывает трех детей, все дети взрослые и обустроены.Паязбек, в поисках источника дохода, начал заниматься изготовлением мебели для себя, затем для друзей и знакомых. Начав свой бизнес в 1995 году, Паязбек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, приносящего на сегодняшний день прибыль в 10,000 KGS ежемесячно от изготовления и продажи мебели. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Паязбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов для изготовления мебели. В будущем, Паязбек планирует расширять бизнес и быть готовым принимать оптовые и большие заказы
texts.en:
Payazbek is a 52-year-old married father of three. His children are all grown up and settled. 

While searching for new sources of income, Payazbek began to make furniture for himself as well as for friends and acquaintances. He began this business in 1995. Since then he has invested all his strength into developing his business, which today brings him a monthly income of 10,000 som from furniture production and sale. 

With long-term business development in mind, Payazbek turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 55,000 som loan. He needs to purchase materials for furniture production. In the future, Payazbek plans to expand his business and to accept wholesale and large orders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single and has five children aged between eight and twenty years. They are in school and live at home.

Yassah has been operating a restaurant for the past nineteen years. She started the business with help from her boyfriend and she learned the business from her mother. Her favorite part of the business is the profit she makes every day and the fact that she has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, rice, onion, peppers, fish, meat and oil for her business. She appreciates the support of BRAC and promises to repay her loan on time.

In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, rice, onion, peppers, fish, meat and oil for her business.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is from the village of Kvemo Khvedureti. He is 31 years old, single and lives with his parents. His father is a pensioner and also works as a stone-mason. Zaza cultivates a family-owned plot of land, growing carrots, beets, onions and potatoes and selling them to vegetable retailers. In addition, the family has a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. The cheese is sold at the local open market. 

Zaza has received a loan as part of a start-up program so that he can establish a new family business. He plans to purchase calves, which he will raise for several months and sell for a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Zaza will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions. Also, part of the additional profit will be reinvested in the new business in order to improve it and increase its profitability.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a member of Wesakulila Group in the Bungoma South District of Kenya. He is pictured with 12 other One Acre Fund farmers (9 women and 3 men) and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for the cultivation of half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Isaac is a new One Acre Fund farmer and joined the fund in order to grow enough food for his family.

Isaac described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Isaac’s group members will take input loans for half an acre each. Thus in total, this group will receive input loans for the cultivation of 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport in Monrovia and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with five children between 7 and 22 years old who all live at home and are in school. She has been selling biscuits, candy, rice and dishes (bowls, plates, spoons) for the past two years.

She started this business with money received from her boyfriend, and she learned this business from her friends. She spends nine hours on her business every day. Her favorite part about her business is that it helps to take care of her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, rice and dishes (bowls, plates, spoons) for her business. In the future she wants to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, rice and dishes (bowls, plates, spoons) for her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 23 years old, from Nakuru, and he is married. They have one child. Moses has a transport business that he has been operating for the past five years, and he has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a rickshaw to use in his transport business. He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 11 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past 7 years Teta has been selling artificial hair in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She spends 9 hours daily with her business, and she is good at managing it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children. She appreciates the support of BRAC and promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Lewa

texts.en:
Lewa lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a tea tree business. She started the business with her own savings. Besides this, she also plants beans, maize and potatoes.

She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenges she faces are seasonal weather and finding customers.

Lewa is applying for a loan of 23,155 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for her business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the business into a larger acreage for tea trees. Her future plan in five years time is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Carroleney

texts.en:
Carroleney is a twenty-eight-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children who are both schooling. She has been in farming for the past four years, producing maize, vegetables and beans that she sells at the local market in her area. 

She wants to venture into poultry farming. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell their products and earn extra income to help her uplift her livelihood and also pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to start a dairy project in the next five years.

Poor transport networks and high competition are her major challenges in farming. She is very thankful to Juhudi kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Nidia Xiomara

texts.es: Nidia de 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo  y dos hijas de los cuales la mayor le ayuda con el trabajo. Nidia posee una venta de pupusas, panes con pollo, platillos típicos, bebidas frías y calientes, y golosinas, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica debido a que hay gran afluencia de personas a diario por su cercanía al mercado municipal del lugar. Nidia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar: pan, golosinas, bebidas frías, café, chocolate, pollo, verduras, granos básicos y todo lo necesario para poder producir mayor cantidad de alimentos ya que en muchas ocasiones se queda sin productos para vender, situación que debe cambiar para mejorar y aumentar sus ventas. Nidia es una persona trabajadora y llena de sueños quien desea sobre todas las cosas mejorar su estabilidad familiar.
texts.en: 44-year-old Nidia lives together with her husband and two daughters.  Her eldest daughter helps her in her work.  Nidia owns a business selling pupusas, 'panes con pollo' (chicken sandwiches), typical Salvadoran dishes, hot and cold drinks, and candies.  Her business is located in a very strategic area which has a lot of daily passersby owing to its proximity to the town market.  Nidia is requesting a loan from Integral to buy bread, candies, cold drinks, coffee, chocolate, chicken, vegetables, basic grains and everything she needs to produce a larger quantity of food because she often finds herself without anything to sell.  She must change this situation if she is to improve and increase her sales.  Nidia is a hard-working person who has many dreams.  Above all, she would like to improve her family's stability.

loans.use: to buy drinks and basic grains, to improve her business

loans.name: Kiadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 47 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a 24-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past three years Kiadiatu has been selling dishes. She started this business with money that she got from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bowls, cups, plates and spoons for her business. In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls, cups, plates and spoons for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and propane gas for making tortillas

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida con quien también trabaja en una granja de crianza de pollos de engorde, ya tiene más de cinco años de trabajar en el mismo lugar, y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus compañeros de trabajo y de su jefe, ya que él es una persona trabajadora, responsable y puntual quien siempre da lo mejor de sí. Carlos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación la cual necesita varias reparaciones como cambio de techo, mejoras en las paredes y piso, esto es primordial para Carlos debido a que se aproxima el invierno y él quiere tener una casa segura en la cual pueda resguardarse de las inclemencias del tiempo y de esta manera vivir seguro y confiado en su hogar junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
50-year-old Carlos lives together with his life partner.  They both work on a farm raising chickens.  They have been working at the same place for more than five years and Carlos has very good references from his work colleagues and his boss as he is a hard-working, responsible, punctual person who always gives his very best.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Integral as he would like to improve the condition of his home.  He needs to carry out a number of repairs including replacing the roof and improving the walls and flooring.  This is essential for Carlos as the winter is approaching and he would like to have a home in which he can shelter from the inclement weather and live more safely and securely with his wife.

loans.use: to repair his home

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 54 years old. He lives in Mtskheta District with his daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. Nugzar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market. Besides that, Nugzar works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nugzar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Nugzar will start a grocery store. He will purchase basic groceries and start a new business. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start up a family grocery store business.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Wesakulila is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by James. The group has 4 women and 6 men. James is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming supplies will be delivered to him on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. James is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, access the best supply prices, grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Last year, James harvested 12 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. He is excited to improve his harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school, to invest in a cow and to buy more land for the family. James’ group members will each receive loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive supplies for 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es: Blanca de 32 años de edad, es una madre muy responsable y trabajadora, ella vive únicamente junto a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes dependen de ella por completo. Blanca se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, chocolate caliente, sodas, café y jugos, su puesto está ubicado sobre la calle principal, este es un lugar estratégico ya que en el camino hay escuelas, iglesias y colonias por lo que es muy concurrido, así mismo cuenta con clientes fijos quienes gustan de desayunar con ricas pupusas, lo cual en ocasiones es difícil de encontrar debido a que la mayoría de ventas de pupusas son únicamente por las noches, lo que le ayuda a Blanca a tener más clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz, frijoles, queso, chicharrón y verduras, de forma que pueda elaborar más pupusas y de esta manera generar más ganancias para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
32-year-old Blanca is a very responsible, hard-working mother.  She lives with her two young children who are completely dependent on her.  Blanca's business is making and selling pupusas, hot chocolate, soda, coffee and juice.  Her stall is located on the main street.  This is a strategic location as there are schools, churches and residential areas which means it is very busy.  She has regular customers who enjoy eating her delicious pupusas for breakfast.  It can often be hard to find pupusas at this time of day because most are sold at night.  This helps Blanca as it increases her number of customers.

Blanca is requesting a loan from Integral to buy corn, beans, cheese, chicharrón (ground pork) and vegetables so that she can make more pupusas and thereby make more profits for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables for making pupusas

loans.name: Rahela

texts.en:
Rahela is a 47-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She has been running a business of selling fabrics for six years with the support of her husband. She offers good quality fabric in various colors and designs, and she makes a profit through her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. 

In order to add more variety to her collection, Rahela applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase more materials in different colors and designs. In this way she will be able to inflate her sales by attracting more customers. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of cloth sales in her area for the last six years. She offers various types of fabric for formal and casual wears. Her collection is much appreciated by the women of her community and she makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 
       
She is a mother of three children; one of them is school-going. She is motivated to provide for her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 6th loan cycle and applied a loan of 35000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more bundles of cloth in various colors and designs, by taking in account the tastes and choices of her customers. 

She hopes to increase her net income through her large sales, and wishes to spend part of the profits on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of cloth in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of kids’ garments. She offers clothes which are very fashionable and trendy. The use of bright color makes her collection even more attractive to the kids. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is motivated to provide for her family. In order to purchase more stocks of kids’ clothing in various colors and designs, she requested a loan of 17000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. 

She wishes to utilize part of the revenues on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of kids’ clothing in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Resham

texts.en:
Ms Resham is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been successfully running a business of cloth trade in her area for the past two years. Due to her business, she has become famous in her community. Her husband is working as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

Resham has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has applied a loan of 25000 PKR to purchase cloth in different designs and colors, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history. She expects boost in her net income through her large sales and desires to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in different designs and colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing (skirts, shorts, tops, etc.)

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a shop of lace in her area for the last three years. She offers lace in various colors and designs. Due to her business, she is well known in her community. Her husband is running a crockery shop, but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 
       
Nasreen is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30000. It would help her to purchase lace and ribbons in various colors and designs, taking into account the demands of her customers. 

She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase lace and ribbons in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old, married, and blessed with two children ages six years and four years, respectively. His spouse - a housewife - and does small scale farming (ie. keeping chickens) to support him in meeting some of their financial needs. Richard runs a transport business and has been in this business for the last four years.

He has borrowed a loan of 85,000 KES. He intends to use the whole amount of this loan to purchase a motorbike to expand his transport business. From this business he gets an average income of 25,000 KES a month. With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business and do more maintenance of his motorbikes. 

His future plan is to buy a plot for building business premises and open a motorcycle spares shop for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms Sharifan is 48 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. She has been successfully running a small general store for the last seven years at the corner of her house. Today, she has become famous in her community for running a store that provides perishables to many households. She counts a good client list and makes enough to bear the expenses of her family members. Her son also assists her in dealing with customers. 

In order to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, and sugar from the market at wholesale rates, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, and sugar from the market at wholesale rates.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Ms Rifat is 35 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking lady who helps her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching and earns enough to lead a decent life. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.35000 to buy a stock of threads with packs of zippers, buttons, and lace in different colors. It would enable her to meet the increasing demand without delay. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads with packs of zippers, buttons, and lace in different colors.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, de 25 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.  Leonardo lleva 3 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería como es la prestobarba, superglu, yilet, cepillos dentales, resistolito, baterías, y otra achinería.  El anteriormente trabajaba como motorista de buses y decidió establecer su propio negocio.  Vende en forma ambulante. Distribuye el producto por cajas y por docenas. Con el préstamo que solicita que es por 7000 lempiras, quiere surtir su inventario de productos como presto barba, superglu y otra achineria que necesita para mantener surtido. Su plan es establecer el negocio en un local fijo en su casa. Agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 25 years old and married.  He lives with his wife in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  For three years Leonardo has been selling merchandise like disposable razors, superglue, tooth brushes, school glue, batteries, and other items.

He used to work as a bus driver, but he decided to establish his own business.  He sells in an itinerant manner, and he distributes the products by the case and by the dozen.

He wants to use the requested loan for 7000 lempiras to stock his inventory.  He will buy products like disposable razors, superglue, and other items that he needs to keep in stock.  His plan is to establish the business in a fixed location in his house.  He is grateful for the support that was given.

loans.use: to buy cases of disposable razors, superglue, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto, tiene 47  años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa y  un hijastro en el municipio de San Luis Comayagua.  Rigoberto estuvo varios años en el extranjero y luego regreso para estar con su familia y hace 6 meses decidió establecer su propio negocio de pulpería, para vender productos alimenticios. Vende azúcar, frijoles, arroz, manteca, jabón, pampers, churros, carnes, productos enlatados, pastillas y otros. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 24,000 Lempiras, quiere surtir el negocio para incrementar las ventas y que los clientes encuentren de todo lo necesario en un solo lugar, también del préstamo quiere comprar estantes de madera para colocar más producto para vender. Pues su meta es lograr sobrevivir con el negocio y hacer que crezca poco a poco.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, age 47, has two children.  He lives with his wife and a stepson in the San Luis Comayagua municipality.  Rigoberto was abroad for several years.  He then returned to be with his family.  Six months ago he decided to establish his own business.  He established a grocery store to sell food products.  He sells sugar, beans, rice, shortening, soap, Pampers, churros, meat, canned goods, over the counter pills, and others.

He wants to use the requested 24,000 lempiras to stock the business.  He will do this in order to increase sales and so that the customers will find everything they need in one place.  He also wants to use the loan to buy wooden shelves to put out more products to sell.  His goal is to manage to survive in the business and to make it grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy food products, cleaning products, and wooden shelving.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, tiene  47 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida. Ella es muy emprendedora anteriormente elaboraba y vendía lácteos y hace 4 años se dedica a la  venta de golosinas, refrescos, churros y comidas. También tiene cría y engorde de pollos para vender de donde obtiene otros ingresos. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos en ODEF, el actual es el catorce ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar refrescos, churros y  los insumos para elaborar la comida para la venta. Su meta es crecer el negocio y obtener mayores ganancias para bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Julia, age 47, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in the Esparta Atlántida municipality.  She is very enterprising.  She used to make and sell dairy products.  She has been selling candy, soft drinks, churros, and food for four years.  She also raises and fattens chickens to sell.  By doing so she gets another income.

She has requested several loans from ODEF.  This current request is her fourteenth cycle, and it is for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, churros, and supplies to make food to sell.  Her goal is to grow the business and to get greater income for her personal well-being and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, and supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 42-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Parwin has eight years experience with a small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity, a little business she tries to constantly improve. In the past, Parwin took a loan from Relief International-Microfinance Iraq, which she used for buying an over machine, some small furniture items and an iron with ironing board. Having successfully repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to further enhance her creativity options and also to improve her work conditions. She plans to buy a pattern machine and a small A/C unit and also to renew her work area.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a pattern machine, a small A/C unit and also renew her work area.

loans.name: Santos Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Santos Ramona esta casada, tiene 49 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al bordado de blusas, típicas, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la fabricación de muebles.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos necesarios para su trabajo, telas e hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera que su negocio siga creciendo y sea reconocido en toda la región donde vive.
texts.en:
Santos Ramona is a 49-year old woman, married and mother of three children, two of whom are studying. She studied three years of primary education and makes a living from the embroidery of traditional blouses. She took the initiative to start this business and, as of today, she has four years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, who works in furniture manufacturing. 

She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies for her job: fabrics and threads of different kinds and colors. She expects her business to continue
expanding and to become known in the region where she lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies to embroider.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 43 years old, vigorous, and married with six children. Two of her daughters assist her in her work. For the past 13 years, Mumtaz has run a hand-embroidery business. She is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  Mumtaz is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  

Mumtaz is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls of various colors and in large quantities to meet with her increasing demand. In the future, she dreams of running a training center for the girls of her community. Mumtaz would like to teach embroidery skills so her students can help her to expand her business and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls of various colors and quantities

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is 49 years old. She lives in the Rusvati district with her husband and her daughter. 

Luiza has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Luiza requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 
The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Luiza will start a dental clinic locally. She will purchase dental equipment and operative supplies to satisfy the professional needs of the dentists that will be working at her clinic. Luiza hopes her business will be profitable because of the price range and well qualified dentists. This will increase her income and her family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Ms Bano is 33 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Bano’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

  For this reason, Bano has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Bano is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Embako Group

texts.en:
Monica is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her fellow members of the Embako Group. The 10 of them, including five women and five men, are farmers in the district of Bungoma South. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Monica joined One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season. She is now enrolling in the 2013 Long Rains season. Monica joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Monica describes her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using the future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, repair her home, save for the future and invest in livestock (cows). 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Monica’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en:
Nedaa is a 36-year-old married woman. Her husband is an accountant. They have four children, including two boys and two girls. 

Nedaa makes floral decor pieces using small detergent bottles and soda bottles. She has applied for this loan to buy some plain empty bottles to fill.

loans.use: to buy some plain empty bottles.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 48-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a milk shop where she sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time, Shehnaz has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Shehnaz's husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. 

Shehnaz is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase two more chairs and tables for her shop along with some utensils such as bowls and bottles. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, utensils, bowls, and tables for her shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and has seven children between the ages of 20 and 29, some of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Sarah did not attend school. She runs a small market table where she sells quality fresh fish to earn a living. Sarah was helped by friends to start her business. 

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 31 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has four children between 2 and 13, who attend school and live at home. 

She has been selling used clothes for years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. In future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Robert has earned a living through carpentry work, which has been doing so well with good returns. He is now 37 years of age.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan funds to purchase timber for use in his carpentry work.

In the future, he plans  to buy a truck that he can use to deliver the furniture he makes.

loans.use: to purchase timber.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is 47 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children, aged 15 and 27 years; one is working and living on his own, and the last lives at home and attends school.

For the past five years, she has been selling oil. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business lets her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with grown-up children.

Susan has a clothing business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to see her business grow, and she hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and from Nyandarua South. She is married with six children who are aged between 3 and 15 years.

Margaret has a farming business that she has been doing for the past three years. Margaret has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm for a better harvest.

She hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 36 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married with seven children who are aged between 2 and 15 years.

Tabitha is a farmer, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to buy a bigger piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is still engaged in office and house repair.  His business is going well, and he has many orders which he will implement with great pleasure because it is very profitable.  Due to his loan from Kiva he has paid for his third-year student daughter's tuition fee for her second semester. Now she is a fourth-year student. And Armen now asks for 200,000 Armenian Dram to pay her last semester's education fee.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's last semester tuition fees

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms. Shazia is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a sewing business for the past nine years. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family members. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for the family, he will not be able to manage the expenses of the household, especially considering the educational needs of their children. 

Shazia makes enough money to contribute to the family's income and has become well-known for her work in stitching bed sheets, covers and pillows. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to purchase more thread, buttons, laces and zippers. In this way she will be able to meet the family's increasing demands consistently. Shazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work on her business.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, buttons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy is 35 years old, married, and blessed with five children. For the past seven years, he has been supporting his family by supplying bread to his customers who mostly own retail shops. Soy earns a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

Soy is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase more bread to supply his customers. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to improve his business. In the future, Soy dreams of improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bread

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 22-year-old single guy with two sisters and a brother. He is a third-year student majoring in accounting. To be able to support himself and pay for his semester fees, Issa works after school. 

Issa is requesting an educational loan to pay for his semester and registration fees as he is short on money for the next semester.

loans.use: to pay semester and registration fees

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and daughter in a rented house. Her husband opened a mini market to support his family, since his retirement salary was not enough. On the other hand, Arwa also started selling clothes at home to friends and neighbors. 

Now Arwa is applying for a loan to bring in more clothes for older ages to have more variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to bring in more clothes for older ages to have more variety to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old farmer in Kitale county, in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and seven children, two of whom are still schooling. She has been in farming for the past nine years, producing milk, maize, and poultry products which she sells at the local market. She runs a green grocery  store as an additional source of income.

Mary is requesting a KES 40,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell the products and earn extra income to help her uplift her livelihood and also pay for her children’s schooling.
