She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years. Poor transport networks and unreliable markets for her products are her major challenges in farming. Mary is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 51-year-old mother of six children. She sells blankets at home to help her husband to pay some of the household bills. She is now applying for this loan to buy bigger sizes of blankets and new styles of bed covers.

loans.use: to buy bigger sizes of blankets and new styles of bed covers for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old and married with four children between the ages of six and 23 years. Her children live and home and attend school. She lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. For the past 11 years, Esther has been running a small shop where she sells used clothes. She started her business with money given to her by her husband and is able to save her profits. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 33 years old. She lives in Congo town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 7. Only one child is in school, and both of them live at home. 

For the past eight years, she has been selling used clothes, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business lets her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has repaid his previous loan well and in good time. His dairy business is doing well.

Julius is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to buy animal feed so that he can get more milk to sell to his customers. He hopes to open a dairy shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort  is 40 years old and is married with eight children between the ages of nine and  29. One of her children is working, two are living on their own, and the others live at home and attend school. Comfort lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. For the past 10 years, she has been running a small shop where she sells charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap. Comfort started her business with money given to her by her husband and she is able to save her profits.

Comfort is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap

loans.name: Bashir Ave

texts.en:
Bashir Ave is a 41-year-old, married man, with four children, living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to the University level. 

He is a farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for over 20 years. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy more land. Unpredictable weather changes and bad roads affect his business while his desire is to venture into modern farming, so as to increase output. 

Bashir Ave intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies, such as manure and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a hard-working man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been growing tea and he started the business after dropping out of school due to lack of school fees. Like most farmers, he is challenged by weather changes and the high cost of production, while his dream is to become the leading grower in the area. 

Micheal intends to use the loan to pay workers who are helping him in harvesting tea to sell.

loans.use: to pay workers who are helping him in harvesting tea to sell.

loans.name: Bunyibunyi Group

texts.fr: Borauzima est une femme dynamique, vice présidente de l'association d'affaire Bunyibunyi. Agée de 28ans, mère de 4 enfants qui n'ont pas encore atteint l’âge d’étudier est mariée à un enseignant d'une école publique. Elle débuta son commerce grâce aux fonds reçu de son mari et de sa grande sœur en 2007. Le crédit sollicité va lui permettre de s’approvisionner avec 2 cartons de piles, 5 douzaines de lait de beauté, 1 carton de tabac, 2 cartons de savon, 1 box emballage plastics. Elle craint la concurrence mais a des ambitions de progresser dans son activité en ouvrant des extensions dans des zones reculées. Elle remercie Hekima d'avoir attaché son attention aux entreprises féminines.
texts.en:
Borauzima is a dynamic woman and vice-president of the Bunyibunyi business association. She is 28 years old, married to a public-school teacher, and mother of four children who are not yet old enough to go to school. She started her business with funds that she received in 2007 from her husband and her older sister.

The loan that she is currently seeking will enable her to buy 2 boxes of batteries, 5 dozen boxes of beauty lotion, 1 box of tobacco, 2 boxes of soap, and 1 box of plastic packaging. She fears competition, but she is striving to move her business forward by expanding into rural areas.

She would like to thank Hekima for dedicating its attention to women's businesses.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of batteries, 5 dozen boxes of beauty lotion, 1 box of tobacco, 2 boxes of soap, 1 box of plastic packaging

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and lives in Congo Town, in Montserrado County, which has the largest port in Liberia (The Freeport of Monrovia) and is the number one commercial county in the country. She is married, with five children that live at home and attend school. 

For the past 17 years, Mary has been selling rice, oil, and pepper, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice ,oil, okra, and pepper for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice ,oil, okra, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Bicoty

texts.en: Bicoty, a 23-year-old single mother blessed with one child, has been running a retail shop for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD to restock her shop with tea leaves, flour and fat to sell. Bicoty's anticipated profits will support her business expansion plans. Her dream is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase household items and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Kingmah

texts.en: Kingmah is 50 years old, and lives in the town of Congo in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children aged 18 and 22 years old, they are in school and only one lives at home.  For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells used clothes.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  The business allows her to save more money.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing.

loans.name: John Patrick

texts.en: John Patrick used the previous loan to buy farm inputs. He is a 57-year-old married man with six children. He is living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to become a role model for farmers in his area. John's major challenge has been high transport fees when taking his produce to the markets.  His dream is to buy a lorry to help with the transportation. John Patrick intends to use the loan to plant more sugar cane and buy paddocking materials.

loans.use: to plant more sugar cane and buy paddocking materials.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a business selling shoes that she started with capital of 1,000,000 shillings, and her current working capital is 1,500,000 shillings. Her main hardships are finding more customers, price fluctuation and inflation, while her vision is buying land to grow crops.

Christine used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children, the purpose for which she is requesting this loan. Her personal goals are building a permanent residence and educating her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marangu

texts.en:
Marangu lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. Besides this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, and beans for the last 17 years. The oil from the tea plant is used to manufacture cosmetics.

Marangu learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.

Marangu is applying for a loan of KES 10,734 (Kenya shillings) to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to expand the area for tea trees and open a cereals shop.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. The oil from this plant is used to manufacture cosmetics. Besides this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize and beans for the last 15 years.

Harrison learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water. Harrison is applying for a loan of 7,794 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to expand the area under tea tree.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her locale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hija y sus nietos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  confeccion y venta de ropa bebes, son prendas cómodas, frescas y con lindos bordados que le dan un estilo único y novedoso, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Herminia es una mujer comprometida y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en estas semanas incrementaron las ventas y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión que la lleve un paso mas adelante con su negocio, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, hilos, etc. Herminia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Herminia lives with her life partner, her daughter and her grandchildren in their own home.  She makes and sells baby clothes which are comfortable, fresh and decorated with pretty embroidery, which gives them a unique and novel style.  She has worked in this business for a number of years, gaining a great deal of experience which enables her to generate higher income.  She sells her goods around the area as well as from her home and has built up a large clientele; people prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices, her goods are always of good quality and she gives excellent service.  Herminia is committed and dedicated to her work, is always striving for what she wants and never thinks of giving up until she has achieved the success she deserves.  Over the last few weeks her sales have increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment which will take her a step forward with her business.  However, she does not have the capital to underpin this.  This is why she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan which will enable her to make bulk purchases of fabric and thread etc. Herminia has good payment references and is very responsible.  She guarantees that she will be able to repay her debt and additionally trusts that it will make her household financially secure.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of fabric and thread

loans.name: Lang'at

texts.en:
Lang'at is 23 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has run a phones shop for the last three years making a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase some phones and phones accessories for sale.
The anticipated profits will increase his working capital. His future dream is to educate his children and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase phones and other phone accessories.

loans.name: Felecial

texts.en: Felecia is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with two children, 2 and 13 years old, they are in school and live at home. For the past eight years she has been selling bitter-ball, pepper, and fufu (dough made of grain cassava). She started this business with money given to her by her brother.  Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter-ball, pepper, and fufu for her business. In the future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter-ball, pepper, and  fufu.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old, married and supports a family of ten. He buys and sells heifers which have been his business for the last 13 years where he makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

With a first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, he plans to purchase some heifers for fattening and later resell at a profit. The anticipated profits will support business operations. 

His future dream is to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase heifers for fattening and later resale

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en: Adolf is member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He sells secondhand clothes and also practices farming. The good father that he is, Adolf desires to educate his children up to the university and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them. Price fluctuations and inflation are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Adolf intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 24 years old and married to Esther. He has a food stall from which he sells various types of foods such as sausages, chips, as well as fried and boiled eggs. He has been in this business in Thika town for the past three years. The business has been profitable since it has enabled him to support his two siblings by paying their school fees.

This will be Nelson's first loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy a cooking pan and meshed wire frame for preparing the sausages and chips. He also plans to buy more stock of eggs for use in the business.

Nelson hopes to grow his business and make more income so as to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a cooking pan, meshed wire frame and add stock of eggs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 52 years of age and a single mother to three children, has a boutique business in Thika town. She has been in the business for 10 years and it has been profitable. She sells dresses and blouses for women as well as school uniforms. She also does a tailoring business, that is sewing clothes and selling sewing materials.

This being her first loan from KADET LTD, Lucy will use the amount to buy more stock of clothes for sale as well as sewing materials. She anticipates generating more income with which she plans to buy more variety of clothes and shoes for sale.

Lucy hopes to grow her business by opening another boutique business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. Besides this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, and beans. The oil from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics.
He learned of Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.
Daniel is applying for a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to purchase a pickup to transport the farm produce.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her small coffee business, which sells dry coffee.

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry coffee to sell, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and cater to her family’s basic needs. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale business.

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more dry coffee to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. Besides this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, beans and wheat. This other type of farming has been doing for ten years. The oil from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics.
He learned of Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.
Stephen is applying a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 25 years old, married and supports three people. She has bought and sold green tea leaves for the last two years making a monthly income of KES. 22,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 10,000. She plans to purchase more tea leaves to sell. The anticipated profits will help expand her business stall.
Her future dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more green tea leaves to sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She owns a tea tree farm, a business she has been operating for one year now. She also has a small-scale agricultural farm, dealing in maize, beans, potatoes, etc.

She learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group. She joined the group with a goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The main challenge she faces is lack of water.

Judith is applying for a loan of 20,730 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan is to open a cereals shop in five years.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. In addition to this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, beans, etc. The oil from the tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with a goal of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.

Haron is applying for a loan of 10,734 KES to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to open a cereals shop.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a tea tree farm, a business he has been operating for one year now. In addition to this, he has been a horticultural farmer, planting potatoes, maize, and beans. He also raises cattle. The oil from the tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with a goal of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are lack of funds and water.

Stanley is applying for a loan of 10,734 KES to buy tea tree seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family. He aspires to increase his acreage of tea trees.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Alice B.

texts.en: Alice is 44 years old, and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman, they have three children between 13 to 18 years old that live at home and attend school. For the past year she has been selling dough (Bread). She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business allows her to save more money.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, sugar, flour, and baking powder for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, sugar, flour, and baking powder for her business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She owns a tea tree farming business, which she has operated for one year. She also has an agricultural farm where she grows maize, beans, potatoes, etc.

She learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group, and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The main challenge she faces is a lack of water.

Charity is applying for a loan of 10,734 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for her business. The extra income that results from the loan will be added to her savings then used to expand her agricultural business. In five years, she hopes to invest in greenhouse farming.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Hasila

texts.en:
Hasila is a 24-year-old divorced woman, who raises her one son alone. She is an IDP and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Hasila raises cattle and has done this for the last 5 years.

Hasila usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more profitable price at the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Hasila also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cows, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cows, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is a 49-year-old man on a pension.  He is an IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and four children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 16 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and also used to make fresh punch.

Ilqar sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.
As his products are in high demand, Ilqar wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 30 years old and lives in the Paynesvilleare; this is one of the populated areas of Montserrado County. She is single and has three children between 7 and 14 years old, they are currently in school and live at home.  For the past 2 years she has been selling rice, oil, water, soft drinks, etc. in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit and has more customers now.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, cool-water, soft drinks, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, cool-water, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Massah N. T.

texts.en: Massah N. T. is 43 years old and lives in the Paynesville South, one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County; she is married and her husband is a doctor. They have 8 children between 19 and 30 years old. Four are currently in school and live at home. For the past eight years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase 50 bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago and Epiphania manage a cacao farm with around 700 trees in the village of Pueblo Viejo. The village is located outside the electric grid, next to an under way highway that will connect western Belize with eastern Guatemala. The couple has raised 11 children, the youngest of who is 15 and oldest 33. 

The farm is truly a family business, as everybody is expected to help out when they can. Epiphania has been instrumental in growing and harvesting cacao. “We’re trying to have a better product. Especially now that we can sell it wet, we just need to take care of the trees,” says Santiago. The possibility of selling wet cacao at the farm gate has passed the burden of fermenting and drying from the farmers onto the buyers. 

A cacao farmer of seven years, Santiago started growing cacao inspired by the arrival of a new market in Toledo. Equipped with some seeds and bags for planting them from the local co-op, Santiago planted his cacao in the foothills of the Maya Mountains and has been successfully tending to them ever since. His favorite thing about cacao is that once it’s producing, it is a secure and stable source of income. “Saturday I harvest, Sunday I have the money. It’s not like planting beans and corn, which takes six to eight months to harvest,” says Santiago. For Santiago, the most challenging part of cacao is fermentation, because the beginning of cacao harvest coincides with the end of the rainy season. 

The family is requesting this loan to hire help with cleaning their 700 cacao trees as well as bagging 200 new seeds for a planned farm expansion. Once bagged, the seeds take about six months to grow to seedlings that can be transplanted into the ground as soon as it has at least four healthy leaves. The cleaning and bagging will require and create 64 hours of labor in the community.

loans.use: To clean 700 cacao trees and expand farm

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido, age 65, and his wife Andrea live in the beautiful village of San Jose, which is located in the foothills of the Maya Mountains. San Jose is one the oldest village in the Toledo district with a population of over 500 who are mostly Mopan Maya and are the main producers of cacao in the district.

Brigido and his wife have seven children, who are all involved in cacao production, and are currently residing in San Jose. His wife helps him on the farm with harvesting and cracking cacao pods at harvesting time. Brigido was encouraged to plant cacao by his dad to have a reliable means of income. “I like cacao because it is a permanent crop and I can earn my income from it for the rest of my life,” says Brigido. 

“My favorite part is picking, because I know that I am picking money from the tree,” says Brigido. The challenging part for him is cleaning around the cacao farm – chopping the underbrush to clear access to trees. 
 
The family is requesting this loan in order to hire people for cleaning and pruning the cacao farm. Pruning is the process of removing non-productive branches to raise yields for the next crop and is typically done towards the end of the cacao harvest season. A part of the loan will also be used to bag soil so that they can expand their six acres cacao to eight acres.

loans.use: To clean, prune and expand cacao farm

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en:
Rahman is a 45-year-old man. He is an IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch.

Rahman sells his crops in the Bilasuvar Settlement and sometimes in the bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.
As his products are in high demand, Rahman wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 2000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. He has a long loan history with AqroInvest and has used this credit union more than five times, which proves he is a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 29 years old and live in Paynesville South, which is in Montserrado County. She is married; her husband is a businessman. Together they have three children aged between three and ten. The children are in school and live at home. For the past eight years Musu has been selling fashion slippers in the local market. She make a good profit and has many customers. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more fashion slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for her business,

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 29 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She and her boyfriend, who is a college student, have three children between three and ten years old. Their children are currently in school and they all live at home. 

Since 2010, Blessing has been selling palm oil in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 28 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is farmer who has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last five years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every family's table in Azerbaijan. They are also used to make fresh punch.

Rashad sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 250 AZN. His wife actively helps him to grow the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Rashad wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose he applied for 600 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10. All of her children are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish meat, charcoal, vita, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish meat, charcoal, vita, etc.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works with a micro-finance institution as a credit officer and has been in service for four years. He is challenged by the low salary that he earns which does not enable him to support his family since his parents are out of work. His dreams are to educate his siblings and also to upgrade his own studies. Collins intends to use the loan to pay the fees for his brother at university.

loans.use: to pay fees for his brother at university.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: EL CAPS La Breña es un comité de Agua Potable, ubicado en la ciudad de Nandaime, municipio del departamento de Granada, Nicaragua. El CAPS tiene 25 años operando, abastece de agua potable a 283 usuarios de las comunidades de Las Breñas 2 y 3, Los vado, La Montañita y El Tendal. El CAPS representado por su Coordinador Marcos Antonio, solicitan financiamiento para compra de tubos y llaves maniables de la red de distribución, los cuales se encuentran en mal estado por los años de uso, con esta inversión se evitaran las derramas de agua y se reducirían los gastos de mantenimiento, beneficiando a 1,415 personas entre niños, jóvenes, adultos y ancianos.
texts.en:
EL CAPS La Breña is a potable water group.  It is located in the city of Nandaime, Granada department, Nicaragua.  EL CAPS has been operating for 25 years, and it provides potable water to 283 users in the Las Breñas 2 and 3, Los Vado, La Montañita, and El Tendal communities.

EL CAPS is represented by its coordinator, Marco Antonio.  They are requesting a loan to buy pipes and valves for the distribution system.  The current ones are in bad shape due to years of use.  With this investment they will avoid water leaks and reduce maintenance expenses.  This will benefit 1,415 people, which includes children, adolescents, adults, and the elderly.

loans.use: to buy pipes and valves for the water distribution system.

loans.name: Marina Jose

texts.es: La joven Marina de 21 años es soltera, estudia la carrera de medicina general con 6 años de duración, ella no trabaja, gracias a la ayuda de su padre y una beca por ser excelente alumna ha salido adelante con sus estudios superiores dedicandose de lleno a ello, necesita comprar unos libros y otros utensilios por lo que está solicitando apoyo de crédito para poder comprar estas herramientas para su desarrollo y conocimiento en la universidad, le gusta su profesión desde la edad de los doce años porque es una carrera humanista que está en contacto con los seres humanos.
texts.en: Marina is 21 years old and is single.  She is studying medicine, a six year course.  She does not work.  Thanks to help from her father and a scholarship for excellency in her studies, she has advanced in her studies, dedicating herself to them completely.  She needs to buy some books and other materials and so is applying for a loan.  She will then be able to buy the tools she needs for to progress at university.  She has liked medicine since she was 12 years old because it is a subject where she is in contact with people.

loans.use: to buy books and tools.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 48 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area that is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is a widow, with six children between the ages of 15 and 30. Only four of the children are in school and live at home.

For the past ten years, Garmai has been selling rice, oil, pepper, vita, and other items in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. 

Garmai is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, vita, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Loyiti

texts.en: Loyiti is a 24-year-old hardworking man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher and was inspired into service by his desire to work with young people. He says that the meager salary he earns cannot fully enable him to achieve his ambition of becoming wealthy. Thus he wants to venture into agriculture. Loyiti is requesting a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 33-year-old ambitious man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For 10 years now he has been operating a retail shop. He got the initial capital from his salary savings as a teacher. He was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. Low pay and long distance to work pose challenges to his work while his desire is to expand his business into a wholesale shop. Jackson intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Kelyn Cecibel

texts.es:
Kelyn, está casada, vive con una hija de seis años, su esposo trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella administra una tienda de productos básicos, ella comenzó el negocio como una forma de ingreso para su familia, considero que le ayudaría a mejorar, su horario es de siete de la mañana a siete de la noche.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de boquitas, sodas, papel higiénico, dulces, frijoles, arroz, esto le ayudará a aumentar su inventario y a mejorar la atención a los clientes.

El objetivo de ella es que su calidad de vida y la de su familia cada día esté mejorando, por eso a través del negocio espera poco a poco cambiar su condición actual.
texts.en:
Kelyn is married and lives with her six-year-old daughter. Her husband works and helps her with the home expenses. She runs a store which sells basic products. She started this business as a means of improving her family's income for her family. She works from 7 in the morning until 7 at night.

She is applying for a loan to buy snacks, sodas, toilet paper, sweets, beans, and rice. This will help her to increase her inventory and improve her customer service.

Her goal is to improve her quality of life and that of her family every day. Through her business, she hopes to change their current conditions little by little.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soda, toilet paper, sweets, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y administra un comedor, vive con sus hijos de 7, 12, 18, la vivienda en la que residen es de adobe (ladrillo de tierra), todos sus hijos dependen de ella, realiza la venta y ellos le colaboran, se traslada al mercado a hacer el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la comida, como frijoles, arroz, condimentos, aceite y otros materiales necesarios, con lograra fortalecer el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Ella quiere poder generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia, espera a través del negocio lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ana sells tortillas and manages a diner.  She lives with her children (ages 7, 12, and 18) in a house made of adobe.  All of her children are dependent on her.  Ana is responsible for making sales and she and her children help one another.  She travels to the market in order to conduct her business.  

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing food such as beans, rice, condiments, oil, and other necessary items.  This will strengthen her business and improve her earnings.  Ana wants to generate more income for her family, so she hopes to accomplish this through her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, condiments, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Paynesville South in Montserrado County. She is 26 years old and single with three children between four months and eight years old. Two are currently in school and all live at home. For the past six years she has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with a little money received from her husband. Alice enjoys selling to her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to increase her business. Alice plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to increase her business,

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en: Marthaline is 30 years old and lives in the area of Paynesville South in Montserrado County. She is single with four children between 11 to 16 years. Her children are currently in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been selling pepper and palm oil in the local market. She make a lot of profit and has many customers. Marthaline is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper and palm oil for her business,

loans.name: Kebeh

texts.en: Kebeh is 32 years old and lives in the area of Paynesville South, one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a teacher. They have an 11-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past five years, she has been involved in the sales of red oil (palm oil) and charcoal in the local market. She make a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil and charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Teta

texts.en: Teta is 28 years old and live in Paynesville South, one of the populous area in Montserrado County. She is single and has three children between the ages of  8 and 14 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling ice in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ice for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ice for her business.

loans.name: Partience

texts.en: Partience live in Paynesville South in Montserrado County. She is 23 years old and single with three children between three months and four years. One child is in school and all three live at home. For the past three years Partience has been selling red oil (a healing solution) in the local market. Partience says that she is proud of her business because of the money she generates every day. Her oldest brother helped her to start this business with a little money. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more red oil to expand her business. In the future she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost a year ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Libertad 4 (Freedom) in one of the rural villages in Samana. She has received two loans to invest in her business selling clothes. Esperanza Internacional is running a program in which most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity to their groups. They can request loans to improve their house, while running their business loans and attending groups meetings. 

Juana is a married woman with two children who do not live with her and husband. Years ago she started building her house, and now is requesting a loan to have her house floor finished. With this loan she will purchase cement, sand and tiles, and will also pay for the building labor and other building materials. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and tiles.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a single mother and has a child. She had been living in deteriorated housing and decided to start building a house. She took out loans with Esperanza almost three years ago to expand her business selling fried food. She used most of her profits to build her house. Now she is requesting a loan to improve her house by purchasing building materials to finish building the walls, part of the roof and also some windows.

Gina is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the group Trabajando para el futuro (Working for the future) in one of the rural villages in Samana, where she has received five loans to invest in her business. Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses loans and attending groups meetings.

loans.use: to buy building materials (concrete blocks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a 33-year-old married man with a child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs  a hardware shop and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and build a residential house. Like most traders in a developing world, he faces hardships due to inadequate capital and the high cost of living. He also grows maize which he supplies to schools and prisons. He is a good father who is determined to change his future and that of his children by educating them up to the university while his business plan is to expand to other markets. Augustine intends to use the loan to buy hardware items such as nails, cement and rods to sell.

loans.use: to buy hardware items such as nails,cement and rods to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old, married man, with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He trades in produce, such as coffee, maize, ground nuts, and beans. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes hinder his business, while his business plan is to own a food store. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy produce, such as maize and beans, to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce, such as maize and beans, to sell.

loans.name: Yuda Tadeo

texts.en:
Yuda Tadeo is a 33-year-old, hard-working, married man, with two children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Yuda Tadeo is a motorcyclist; he also rears goats to earn extra income. After he stopped going to school due to lack of school fees, Yuda Tadeo got a job as a hired rider who had to remit 80% of the daily earnings to his boss. Through hard work, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle. He dreams of becoming a model farmer and buying a taxi. 

Yuda Tadeo is requesting the loan to purchase land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase land for farming.

loans.name: St. Adolf Bakyara Twezimbe Group

texts.en: Felesta is a 32-year-old hard working married woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She acquired her start-up capital from farming. She opened up a retail shop of general merchandise to help her look after her family and has been in business for five years. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the University and dreams of building a permanent house for the family .Felesta is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell. She is a member of a group where every member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
José, tiene un nuevo proyecto de sembrar granos básicos, por eso se decide por solicitar préstamos nuevamente, por la necesidad de invertir en la milpa de regadillo, el regadillo es un sistema de riego para los cultivos del verano, donde se sustituye el agua por la lluvia y a través de esta seguir proveyendo para su familia, él comprara semilla, abono, herbicidas.
Él considera que a través de este trabajo a logrado mantener una buena producción en el cultivo, su cosecha y sus ingresos a través de ella han sido mejor, ha realizado mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
José has a new basic grains planting cycle. This is why he has decided to ask for a new loan because of the necessity of investing in the irrigation of his cornfields, the irrigation system helps maintain crops during summer as a substitute for the rain.  This is how he will continue to provide for his family, buying seed, fertilizer and herbicides.

He believes that through this work he managed to maintain a good yield in the crop production. His harvest and his earnings through this have been better, and he has made improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a parish chief and he practices agriculture. With the profits, he has been able to educate his children and buy fertilizers for his farm, thus yielding high profits. He faces the challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes and his dream is to buy more land to expand his farming activities. Rogers intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to perchase land

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 30 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and manages a food stall business, serving local foods to customers in the community. She's been with her business over two years and earns PHP 14,000 each month. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011. 

Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like soft drinks, pork, chicken, and beef. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like soft drinks, pork, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Sidey Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sidey de  59 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades  de  24, 25 y 27 años,de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su primera experiencia laboral a la edad de 10 años vendiendo, buñuelos y chiverías, es así como ella se ganaba la vida, y de las ganancias que obtuvo de su pequeño negocio, hoy en día  con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido establecer  su pulpería con productos de alta demanda y lo más solicitados por sus clientes, sus expectativas es hacer crecer el inventario de su negocio. 
Se acerca la temporada escolar y es por eso que Sidey está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros, borrador, regla, mochila, faldas escolares, etc. Ya que ella  estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería en general que aún no tiene en existencia para agregar a su pulpería, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área de negocio.
texts.en:
Sidey, 59 years old, is originally from Granada. She is the mother of two who are between the ages of 24, 25 and 27 years old. She is the owner of a convenience store.  She gained her first business experience at the age of 10, selling pastries and dairy products, and that is how she made a living. These days, through great effort and hard work, she has been able to establish her store, selling items that are in high demand and most requested by her customers. Her expectations are to grow her store's inventory.

School time is drawing near and this is why Sidey is requesting a loan to purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, backpacks, school uniform skirts, etc. She believes this loan will help her purchase all the merchandise in general that she doesn't already have to grow her store. Her plan for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, backpacks, school uniform skirts, etc.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción, tiene la edad de 62 años, vive solo  actualmente. El con el crédito quiere comprar los insumos y la semilla para sembrar pasto para el cuido de ganado. El cuenta con un lote actualmente desocupado y es de optimas condiciones para la ganadería  por lo cual quiere realizar esta siembra. El quiere darle un buen uso al terreno. El pretende con el crédito generar una excelente asistencia a la siembra y así poder meter unos animalitos a futuro y obtener  el máximo de ganancias económicas para su bienestar  y su estabilidad económica. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Concepción, 62, currently lives alone.  He plans to use the loan to buy supplies and seeds to plant fodder for his cattle.  He has a patch of land which is not in use and would be perfect for cattle raising, hence his desire to plant fodder.  He wants to put the land to good use and believes the loan will help him get started with the planting so he can put the animals there in the future.  This will allow him to earn a good profit for his well-being and economic stability.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had access to any state bank loan; FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 31-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a bar, lodge and also has a pool table. With the proceeds he has been able to buy land and provide the basics for his family. High license fees and price fluctuation pose a challenge to his profit growth while his dream is to be a proprietor of a five star hotel. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Nilo is married and has one child. 

Nilo owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Nilo has been engaged in his business for four years and earns PHP 17,000 per month. 

Nilo is requesting a loan of PHP 18,500, which will be used to repair his motorcycle, so he can offer better service. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle, so he can offer better transport service.

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es:
Hilda Yaneth
En Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez, vive la señora Hilda Yaneth, quien tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la confeccion de blusas de tela para damas, Al lado de su esposo don Pablo le dan gracias a Dios por el trabajo abundante que tienen en su pequeño taller.  Ella tiene varios pedidos de blusas pero aun le hace falta comprar tela de varios colores para poder completar sus pedidos.  El dinero que ella tiene no le alcanza por tal motivo ella hace su tercera solicitud de crédito para comprar rollos de tela valorados en Q. 950.00 cada uno.  Son varios colores los que necesita y dos tipos de tela que ella trabaja para la confeccion de las blusas, y necesita comprarla porque tiene ya varios pedidos y no les quiere quedar mal a sus clientes y así ganar su dinero con la venta que realizara.
texts.en:
Hilda Yaneth lives in Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez.  She has two children and makes a living making women's blouses of fabric.  She and her husband, Pablo, are grateful to God for the abundant work they have in their small workshop.  She has various orders for blouses but still needs to buy fabric in a variety of colors to be able to finish the requests.

She doesn't have enough money so she's requesting her third loan to buy rolls of fabric worth 950 quetzales [GTQ] each.

She needs several colors and two types of fabric she uses to make her blouses.  She needs to buy it because she has several requests and she doesn't want to make a bad impression on her customers.  This way she'll earn her money with the sale she'll make.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Carla Vanesa

texts.es:
Carla de 36 años de edad, casada con tres hijos de 9, 17, 18 todos estudia. Es  originaria de la Paz Centro. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La paz centro se caracteriza por sus  comidas típica y bebida como el quesillo y el tiste. Carla es una persona que ha luchado duro en la vida, no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. La cual la obligo a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por tanto ella quiere para sus hijos un futuro mejor. Lo cual la motiva a superarse día a día.
Gracias a su ganas de superación es que tiene por  actividad económica la venta de repuesto de moto, desde hace 3 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad ubicada en su casa de habitación. El negocio consisten en vender repuestos de moto como: bomba, estop, accesorios, balineras, neumáticos, llantas, forros de asiento. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta repuesto. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Carla agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para brindarles un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
36-year-old Carla is married with three children of 9, 17, and 18 years of age, all of whom are studying. She is originally from Paz Centro, which is located in the western part of the country. La Paz Centro is characterized by its food and drink, such as "el quesillo" (a soft fresh cheese) and "el tiste" (a drink made from tortilla, cacao beans, allspice, sugar, and water). Carla is a person who has worked hard in life. She could not study due to the lack of economic resources, which forced her to work from an early age. For this reason, she wants her children to have a better life, and this motivates her to keep improving her life day after day.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she makes a living from selling motorcycle parts. She has been doing this for three years from her home. The business consists of selling motorcycle parts, such as: pumps, brake lights, accessories, ball bearings, tires, wheel rims, and seat covers.

The loan is for investing working capital into her business and stocking it with spare parts to sell so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better revenue. Carla is grateful for the help Kiva investors give to people of scant resources and poor countries like Nicaragua by giving them the opportunity of having decent work.

loans.use: to invest working capital into her business and stock it with motorcycle parts, such as pumps, brake lights, accessories, ball bearings, tires, wheel rims, and seat covers.

loans.name: Mariana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maríana del Socorro de  62 años, madre soltera con un hijo de 15 anos, es originaria de la  Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro se caracteriza por sus comidas y bebidas típicas, como el quesillo y tiste. Maríana del Socorro siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente le ha tocado ser madre y padre para su hijo , el cual sus deseos son brindarle mejores oportunidades de las que ella tubo, en la vida y fórmalo como un profesional.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, desde hace seis años. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shampo, sobre de café, sobres de salsa de tomate, cigarrillos menudeados, jugos, gaseosas, pan, leche, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano tenga mejores ingresos.  Maríana del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maríana del Socorro is 62 years old.  She is a single mother with a 15 year old son.  She is originally from La Paz Centro, which is located in the western part of the country.  La Paz Centro is known for typical food and beverages, like quesillo (a tortilla wrapped around cream, onions, and cheese) and tiste (corn powder mixed with cocoa and milk). Maríana del Socorro has always been a hardworking and responsible woman, with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately she has had to be both mother and father to her son, whom she wants to provide with better opportunities than she had in life, and with an education to become a professional. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, for the past 6 years she has had a "pulpería" located in her home.   A pulpería is a small store that sells food items and other products in small quantities such as shampoo, packets of coffee, tomato sauce packets, cigarettes, juice, soda, bread, milk, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and eggs.  This loan will be used as working capital to stock her store, so that in a not too distant future she will have greater income.   Maríana del Socorro is thankful for the assistance that the Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have an opportunity to obtain decent work.

loans.use: to invest as working capital and to stock her store with products for sale such as shampoo, coffee packets, packets of tomato sauce, cigarettes, juices, sodas, bread, milk, beans, sugar, cooking oil, eggs.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en: Cerilo is a 52 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Cerilo owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas that he sells to earn a living. He's been with his business over four years and he earns 8,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC in 2009 and now he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 55 years old, married, with one child. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Isidra owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She's been with her business over five years and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010. 

Isidra requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise on her farm.

loans.name: Lavender

texts.en: Lavender is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Lavender is married and has two children. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 19,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 22,500 PHP, which will be used to repair her motorcycle so she can offer better service. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle so she can offer better transport service.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, married, with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She operates a local firewood business, selling to customers in the community. She's been with her business over two years and earns PHP 1,500 each month. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012. 

Marilou is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Estrella owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale, to earn a living. She's been in business for over six years and earns 12,500 PHP each month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 49 years old and separated, and she has one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Aileen operates a family member's business, providing motorcycle transport services. Aileen has been in this line of work for over five years and earns 29,000 PHP a month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2006. Now she is requesting a loan of 42,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle, for better service. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle, for better service.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Four of her children are in school. Herminia is a very hard-working entrepreneur, who has a business, retailing rice in the Philippines.

Herminia requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more rice to sell. She has been in this business for five years. 

Herminia would like to save enough money in the future, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: María Marta vive junto a su pequeña familia en casa propia; ella  posee una tortillería que es muy conocida por el lugar pues tiene muy buena fama de elaborar las tortillas mas ricas y siempre calientitas, el negocio esta ubicado en la residencia y ya tiene varios años con el negocio, se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite elaborar las mejores tortillas y al mismo tiempo obtener las mejores ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que se prepara es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además con el mejor servicio y el mas rápido; María es una mujer activa entregada a su labor, lo que más desea en su vida es cumplir sus sueños, por eso trabaja con mucho esfuerzo sabe que así alcanzara el éxito; desde hace algún tiempo subió a un nivel mas alto y no quiere decepcionar a sus clientes, es así como decidió aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que le permita invertir en insumos, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, leña. María Marta tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, agrádese la colaboración y asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Marta lives with her small family in her own house. She has a tortilla shop which is very well known in the area; she has a good reputation for making the most delicious tortillas that are always hot. Her business, which she has had for a few years, is located in her home. Her experience in her work is very valuable because it has taught her how to make the best tortillas while at the same time earning the most profit possible. She has a good client base because people know that everything that she makes is of the highest quality, as well as being fairly priced with great customer service and quick service. María is very involved in her work. What she wants most in life is to be able to reach her dreams, which is why she works so hard, so that she can be successful. 

Some time ago she reached a point of growth in her business and because she doesn't want to disappoint her customers she has decided that she needs to increase her production, but she needs more capital to be able to invest in supplies. This is why she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy corn at wholesale prices and firewood. María Marta has a good credit background and is very responsible. She is thankful for the collaboration provided through the loan. She promises that she will pay the loan back and at the same time will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale price and firewood.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. Recently, he has begun working as a security guard. 

Before this job, he was a herdsman who cared for various domestic animals, such as sheep, goats, and cows in rural areas. His wife has worked in the local television industry and recently has taken her maternity leave. 

When the family moved to the center of the province from the rural area, he began to reside in a barn attached to a grocery store. The owner of the barn and grocery store is his casual acquaintance who let them take shelter in his barn. As he began to interact with the owner of grocery store, he began to earn his trust and, as a result, his wife is employed as a saleswoman in the grocery store. Also, the family doesn’t pay a rent fee. 

Now, Ariunbold is preparing documents for buying a rightful plot of land from the local authority. He is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to purchase a traditional, Mongolian ger (portable, felt dwelling). As he secures his land, he and his family can live independently in the traditional, Mongolian ger. Also, a felt-made, Mongolian ger is the best in winter time, when confronting a strong wind and storm. Ariunbold is a very hard-working individual who moved to the center of the province in order to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a traditional, Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbayar, 26 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family has inherited a house and plot of land from Munkhbayar’s father. The house has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. 

Munkhbayar has been running a men’s clothing sales business by renting a stall at the trade center since 2006. His stall is better located than the rest of the stalls, and it gave him an edge to attract more permanent customers. 

Munkhbayar is requesting a loan of 6,750,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as planks, cement, bricks and metals. These construction materials will be used for house renovation.  As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. Also, buying materials now will spare a large amount of cash because during this period of the year, the price of construction materials reaches its lowest level. 

Most importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Munkhbayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, planks and cement.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 52-year-old married man with eight children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop where he sells general merchandise. Price fluctuation and the high cost of rent hinder his business growth. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and expand to new areas. Amos is requesting a loan to buy sodas and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and salt to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a mobile money business and raises cattle. His business is located along a busy street, attracting many customers. Inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand hinders his business growth. His dream is to be able to offer the service through other telecommunications to attract customers on the different networks. Geofrey intends to use the loan to buy airtime float to help him transact the mobile money service.

loans.use: to buy airtime float to help him transact the mobile money service.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with five children. She is 56 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Julieta owns a sari-sari store to earn a living, and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and vinegar.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and vinegar.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita. Her previous loan was a big help for her farm. She was able to harvest more sweet potatoes, tangerines, oranges, and other crops and fruits. Her farm business has existed for twenty years now. Their family is getting their everyday expenses from their income from the farm. Julita and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Julita would like to apply for another loan, this time for 32,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julita dreams of being able to give her all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to support community health work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en: Salustia is 56 years old and married. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP. She joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
I Ketut is 49 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  He is married and has four children, all of them still in school. His wife is a housewife and maintains a pig business, at home.  

I Ketut is a cacao buyer. He buys cacao from the farmers and sells it again to the big buyers. He has been in this business for five years.  

I Ketut is seeking a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) to expand his business. With the loan, he will buy more cacao from other farmers, in other villages. With his earnings, he hopes to be able to improve his business, pay school fees, and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more cacao for resale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

Herminia has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase items such as buttons, thread, needles and tools for her tailoring business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items such as buttons, thread, needles and tools.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Joy is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Joy has been farming vegetables for 16 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks and chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
