Mildred is 35 years old, married and has one child currently in school.

Mildred is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business.

Mildred has been farming sugarcane for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment for her business

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en: Ma. Liza, 48 years old, is married to a farmer and they are residing harmoniously in the village of Alinam with their six children. She's been selling and cooking some rice cakes or "puto" for almost 19 years. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 6,000 a month. She would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase evaporated milk, cornstarch, sugar and baking powder. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase evaporated milk, cornstarch, sugar and baking powder

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 57 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nelly has been raising pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from her barber shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is 56 years old and married with four children.

Benigna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Benigna has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and earns additional income from rice and gasoline retailing.

Benigna aspires to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Yolanda has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Yolanda has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her snack vending business.

Yolanda has been a member of PMPC since 2012. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is widowed with 2 children. Jesusa is 65 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Jesusa sells a variety of products in a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents,etc. to sell in her store.

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Jesusa hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy new spare parts for her van and get the maintenance that it needs. She has been in this business for three years now and she is looking forward to having more vans. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their van unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay for the education of their children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will live happily and abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 53 years old and lives in Santa Cruz, Jimenez, in the province of Misamis Occidental in Phillipines. She is married with 6 children. 

Nilda is engaged in a dress-making business and earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional clothing materials and dress accessories for her dress-making business. 

Nilda has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Nilda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials and dress accessories for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is 57 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Renita would like to borrow PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay for a farm laborer.

Renita has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for a farm laborer for her sugarcane farm.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Amgalan is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife used to work at a banking institution and now stays at home. His daughter and son both study at university. He himself has been working as a Senior Accountant in the television industry since 1997 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience, reaching the level of expert. The family is now renting an apartment which has deteriorated very badly over the years. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to cover the costs of a heating system, vacuum windows, a concave ceiling installation, and an updated bathroom and wallpaper. As a result of this, the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place due to the renovations which will also preserve more energy and lose less heat, thereby contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate his deteriorating apartment with a new heating system, vacuum windows, a concave ceiling, an updated bathroom, and new wallpaper.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is married with one child. Billy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Billy is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. He has been doing this for 12 years. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. 

Billy has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Billy hopes to expand his banana farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 46 years old and married with three children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of  PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, frozen foods, snack foods and other groceries for her store.

Veronica has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from E-loading and raising pigs.

Veronica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, frozen foods, snack foods and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 53 years old and married with nine children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, canned goods, noodles, bread, etc..

Carmen has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Carmen aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soap, canned goods, noodles, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila works hard to support her family. Precila is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Precila requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net, wood and other fishing equipment.

Precila has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Precila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, wood and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena junto a su compañero de vida y su madre en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas en variedad, revueltas, de queso, frijol con queso entre otras  tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite elaborar las mejores pupusas y asi obtener as mejores ganancias, comercia desde el lugar que califico como muy buena para su actividad laboral, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que se prepara es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además con el mejor servicio; María es una mujer activa, comprometida a su labor, lo que más desea en su vida es salir adelante y superarse, por eso trabaja con mucha dedicación sabe que así alcanzara el éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumentaron las ventas, es así como decidió aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que le permita invertir en insumos ya que todas sus compras son al contado y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz,  quesillo, chicharrón, verduras, etc. María Magdalena tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable y agradece el apoyo, asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: María Magdalena lives with her life partner and her mother in their own home.  She sells different varieties of pupusas filed with meat and bean and cheese, plain cheese and bean and cheese, etc. She has been doing this for several years and it has been a very worthwhile experience as it has allowed her to make the best pupusas and earn a good living. She sells from a very good location. She has a large clientele because people know that everything she makes is high quality.  She also offers affordable prices as well as the best service. María is active and committed to her job. What she wants most in life is to get ahead and excel. For this reason she is very dedicated to her work because she knows that this is how she will achieve success. In the last few weeks her sales have increased so she decided to increase her production, however, she needs capital to invest in supplies since she buys everything with cash.  She is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy corn, cheese, chicharrón [fried pork rinds], vegetables, etc. María Magdalena has good payment references and is very responsible. She is grateful for the support and is committed to paying off the loan while also giving her family a better life.

loans.use: corn, beans, cheese, chicharrón, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 42 years old and married with three children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emily has been in this business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Emily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 48-year-old married mother of two, lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental where she has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately 3,000.00 each month.

A member of PMPC for almost two years, Lydia has requested a loan to purchase products such as soap, cooking oil, shampoo, toothpaste, salt, and vinegar to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as soap, cooking oil, shampoo, toothpaste, salt, and vinegar for her store.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es casado y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa de sus suegros, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Huayna Potosí  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja con su esposa; ellos elaboran deportivos para varón.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar materia prima en distintos colores y tipos de tela y comprar una maquina overlock, así podrá aumentar en menor tiempo su producción.

El sueño de Edwin es tener una microempresa  de costura y que sus productos se comercialicen a nivel nacional.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Edwin is married and has three children who are all school aged and are studying in a state school. He lives in his parent in laws' home, which is located in the Huavna Potosí zone of the city of El Alto. 

He is requesting the loan to buy materials, like fabrics in distinct colors and types and to buy an overlock sewing machine. This will allow them to increase their production in less time.  

Edwin's dream is to have a small sewing business, from which he will make products to sell at a national level. 

This is the first loan that he has requested a loan through IMPRO, wich KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric of a variety of colors and types and also to buy an overlock sewing machine to minimize the time it takes to make an athletic suit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es casada, tiene un hijo de 5 meses y vive en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel primario y actualmente ella es promotora de productos herba life con la ayuda de su esposo.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar en mayor cantidad los distintos productos que ofrece; además desea aprovechar del precio al por mayor pues tiende a costar menos y sus ingresos serán mejores.

El sueño  de  Maria es ser distribuidora al por mayor.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is married, she has a son aged 5 months and lives in an “anticrético", a home lease agreement (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property). The house is located in the Mariscal Sucre area of the city of El Alto.

She completed primary school and is now a promoter of Herbalife products with the help of her husband. The loan she is seeking is to buy the different products she offers in larger volumes. She is also keen to make the most of bulk prices as it tends to cost less and her income will be larger.

Maria dreams of being a bulk distributor. This is the first time that she is seeking a loan from Impro and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy products from the Herbalife range which she promotes in bulk and sell them in retail to her customers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta  es casada y tiene dos hijos; vive en la casa de su hermana, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la Urbanización Puerta del Sol de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel primario y actualmente ella  se dedica a tejer mantas para señoras de pollera, las mismas las comercializa en una de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para  comprar lanas de distintos colores  y texturas y seguir con su negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos.

El sueño  de  Jacinta es tener una tienda donde pueda vender diariamente sus productos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jacinta is married and has two children. She lives in her sister's home, which is located in the Puerta del Sol housing development in the city of El Alto.  

She studied in primary school and currently makes a living weaving material to be used to make women's skirts. She sells the skirts in a market in the city of El Alto. 

She is requesting a loan to be used to buy wool in a variety of colors and textures; this will allow her to continue with her business, since it is her only source of income. 

Jacinta's dream is to one day have a store where she can sell her products. 

This is he first loan that she has taken out through IMPRO, with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a variety of colors and textures of wool, to continue her business of weaving cloth to be used for women's skirts.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.es:
Flaviana, es viuda, tiene una hija, viven en casa  de su hija, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la Urbanización Nuevo Amanecer de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente ella trabaja en un taller de costura.

El crédito lo requiere para  y cancelar matricula y créditos en la carrera de derecho para su hija en la universidad, dicha carrera la estudia su hija.

El sueño  de  Flaviana es que su hija estudie y pueda apertura su propio bufete de abogados.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Flaviana is a widow, she has a daughter and they both live in her daughter's home. The house is located in the Nuevo Amanecer neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Flaviana completed secondary school and now works in a sewing workshop. She needs the loan to pay the university registration fees and loans for a law course for her daughter, the degree her daughter is pursuing.

Flaviana's dream is that her daughter can study and open her own law firm. This is the first time that she is seeking a loan from Impro and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the Law course registration fees and loans for her daughter.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 64 years old and married with 9 children. He works very hard to provide for them.

Romeo runs a buying and selling nipa business (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell for his business.

Romeo has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Romeo would like to save money so expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell for his business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 33 years old, married and has three siblings. Due to hardship of living, she engages herself in cooking and selling of sweetened foods in their community to supplement her husband's income. Being a hard working mother, she was able to sell more goods and many of her customers are in favor of her products. Many of the store owners make an order with her. In this regard, she has planned to prepare more of her goods but she has not enough capital, therefore, she is asking for an additional of P50,000.00 to buy the needed ingredients like flour, milk, sugar and other materials needed in cooking and preparing the said snack foods. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to produce more finished products to satisfy her customers demand. She hopes that someday, her business will grow and becomes viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar and other ingredients needed in cooking delicacies and sweetened snack foods

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is married with 12 children. Dioscora is 58 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Dioscora owns a general store to earn a living and had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more stocks for her general store such as toothpaste, shampoo and others.
Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store such as toothpaste, shampoo and others.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 
Mely is engaged in dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP1,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of dried fish to sell. 
Mely has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, Mely hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona plan 3000   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente ella es ayudante de cocina. Su esposo es carpintero, así cubren los gastos que tienen.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillos, estuco) ya que realizará la construcción de una habitación y la refacción de su vivienda

Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana is married. She has three children and lives in a house she owns. Her house is located in the Plan 3000 area of the town of El Alto.
She studied up to high school and she's currently a kitchen assistant. Her husband is a carpenter and that's how they can afford their expenses.
The loan she requests is to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, tiles and stucco), because she'll build an additional room and remodel her home.
This is her second loan with IMPRO and her first time on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, tiles and stucco in order to build an additional room and remodel her home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, es casada tiene tres hijos vive en casa de su padre se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente ella comercializa una gran variedad de golosinas (dulces) en la puerta de un colegio. Su esposo es cerrajero.

El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital ya que se aproxima el inicio de clases y necesita adquirir distintas marcas de galletas y dulces para surtir su puesto de venta.

Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Virginia is married and has three children. She lives in her father's house, which is located in the Bautista Saavedra area of the town of El Alto.

She studied up to high school. She currently sells a wide variety of snacks (candy) at the entrance of a school. Her husband is a locksmith.

She requests the loan in order to increase her capital, since school will start soon and she needs to purchase various brands of cookies and candy to stock up her stall.

This is her second loan with IMPRO and her first time on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cookies and candy of various types for her stall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, 61 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 4 years, Erlinda has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from hog raising.

Erlinda has previously borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Erlinda aspires to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel, 43 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 5 years, she has earned a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Hazel also earns additional income from raising chickens and operating a general store. Hazel is borrowing PHP 25,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, es casada  tiene una hija de dos años de edad, viven en casa de sus suegros, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Estrellas de Belén de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente  tiene una tienda donde ofrece a su clientela pollo a la broaster.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar al por mayores insumos como ser: papa, arroz y aceite, para de esta manera ahorrar un poco en los costos y al mismo tiempo mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño  de  Reyna es tener una pensión en la que ofrezca desde desayunos hasta platos a la carta.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Reyna is married, she has a two-year-old daughter and they live in her parents-in-law's home. The house is located in the Estrellas de Belén area of the city of El Alto. Reyna completed secondary school and now has a store where she sells fried chicken to her customers.

The loan she is seeking is to buy supplies in bulk such as potatoes, rice and oil. In this way, she can save a little in terms of costs and at the same time improve her profits.

Reyna dreams of having a restaurant based in her home where she could offer meals from breakfasts to à la carte dishes. This is the first time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice and oil in bulk to continue with her business preparing fried chicken.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan, 62 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Lower Sto. Nino Mahayag, Philippines. Juan has been raising pigs for two years. He has requested a loan to purchase materials for his piggery and for other expenses. Juan has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost one year. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and to fully pay his obligation at Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his piggery and for other expenses.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor, 41 years old, lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 1 child. Nestor is engaged in hog fattening, earning approximately PHP 4,500 each month. He has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for his hog fattening activity. Nestor has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, he hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of pig feed

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the group called La Colmena (The Hive), located in the city of Samana. This is her 9th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over five years, starting when she took her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. Since then she has repaid all her loans and expanded her business.

After her last loan, which she invested in her business, Luz realized the need to build her home. She had started building it on a plot of land she had but she could only build the walls. She talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a housing loan to finish building the floor and the roof.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Luz is the single mother of two children. She works and lives in a rural town. Luz will use this loan to buy wood, zinc, nails, cement and other construction materials to build her floor and a zinc roof. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy zinc plates for her roof and materials for the floor.

loans.name: Zayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zayra ya lleva 5 créditos consecutivos con Afodenic gracias al apoyo de Kiva por lo que esta altamente agradecida, ella ha aprovechado en hacerle mejoras a su hogar para el bienestar de sus hijos que de nueve ahora solamente dos están a cargo de ella siendo madre soltera a los que les ayuda por medio de la venta de tortillas que tiene durante años, medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con todos ellos, ahora doña Zayra solicita un nuevo financiamiento para hacer divisiones de cuarto para ello necesita comprar cemento, arena, hierro, bloques así ella va mejorando su vivienda y brindando mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Zayra has taken out five consecutive loans with AFODENIC thanks to the support of Kiva, for which she is extremely grateful. She is taking advantage of this opportunity to make improvements to her home, thus providing for the welfare of her children. Zayra has nine children, but now only two are still in her care. Being a single mother, she has been able to help her family by selling tortillas over the years. Working in this manner has helped all of her children move forward.

Doña Zayra is now requesting a new loan so that she can put up room dividers. To do this, she needs to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks. As a result, she will improve her home and provide better conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks for installing room dividers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Lolita is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. Lolita hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to build a restaurant at the public market.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen, 33 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past 2 years, Carmen has owned and operated a small piggery. She has requested a loan to purchase more piglets and feed. Carmen has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula, de 58 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Benedicto con quien tiene 10 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos: Ronal, Rafo, Keny y Micaela, en la casa que heredó hace 20 años. Hace 5 años emprendió el trabajo de compra y venta de queso. Afirma que desde entonces tiene mayora vida y ganas de salir adelante, pues viaja cada 15 días a la capital del país donde vende los quesos que ella misma elabora con la leche que producen sus vacas, con el tiempo obtuvo más clientela por lo que empezó a acopiar queso de otros ganaderos. “Me va muy bien en mi negocio, vendo mucho queso y antes de llegar a mi pueblo ya tengo pedido de más”, afirma. Ahora ella desea comprar una vaca lechera nueva para poder aumentar la producción de su ganado, además de seguir sembrando pues le gusta vivir del campo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Ursula, invertirá el dinero en la compra de queso al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ursula, aged 58, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Benedicto, with whom she has ten children, but only four of these- Ronal, Rafo, Keny y Micaela, live with them in the house they inherited 20 years ago. 

Five years ago, she began to work buying and selling cheese. She says that since then, she has had a better life and more motivation to succeed. She travels to the capital city every fifteen days to sell cheese that she makes herself using the milk produced by her cows. Over time, she attracted more customers, and so began to buy cheese from other farmers. 

“My business is going very well, I sell a lot of cheese and before arriving home I already have more orders", she says.

Now, Ursula would like to buy a new dairy cow so that she can increase the amount of milk produced by her herd, as well as continue to grow crops because she likes living from the land. She belongs to the “Niño Jesús” (Baby Jesus) community bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity to progress, and promises to make her repayments on time. She also likes belonging to her bank, where everyone is united.

Ursula will invest the money in buying wholesale cheese.

loans.use: to invest money in buying wholesale cheese.

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yanira, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque realizara el cultivo de granos básicos con su esposo, necesita dinero para invertir en abono, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra, entre otros que sean necesarios para el trabajo agrícola.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, mejoro su alimentación en la familia, sus ingresos y en salud se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en:
Yanira has decided in favor of a new loan.  She will be planting staple foods with her husband, and she needs money to invest in fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay for labor costs, among other things that might be necessary for agricultural work.  

With the last loan, she had a positive outcome:  her family's diet improved as did her income, and her health is very good.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia, 58 years old, is single. She currently resides in the village of Alinam together with her siblings and nieces. Leticia has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years, earning an income of PHP 15,000. She would like to have a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase detergent soaps, canned goods, breads and beverages. Leticia's income is usually spent on the family's daily expenditures. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase detergent soaps, canned goods, breads and beverages

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twelve years and earns additional income from clothing sales. Janice is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 60 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married, with five children. 

Florida has a store where she sells a variety of products, such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for ten years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 (ten thousand pesos) to purchase more stock for her general store, such as soap and toothpaste. Florida has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for 12 years. In the future, Florida hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and mechanize her land in order to cultivate tomatoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 47 años es una mujer noble. Enviudó hace 4 años, desde entonces cuidó de sus 4 hijos a los que cuidó y encaminó, ahora solo vive con 2 de ellos: Miriam y Rut, en la casa que compró hace 20 años.  
“Mi trabajo es sembrar y criar animales, desde que mi esposo murió estas son mis principales ingresos económicos”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el trabajo duro, a pesar de sus necesidades siempre brindó una buena educación a sus hijos, siendo estos profesionales. Posee 7 vacas lecheras de las cuales extrae un promedio de 48 litros de leche diariamente, los cuales comercializa a una distribuidora de leche. Asimismo siembra papa, maíz en diversos terrenos agrícolas de su localidad, que son propios. Ahora ella desea mejorar la producción de leche de sus animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
María, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 47, is a noble woman. She became a widow four years ago, and since then she has taken care of her four children and guided them on their way in life. Now she lives with two of her children, Miriam and Rut, in the house which she bought twenty years ago.

"My work is planting crops and raising animals. Since my husband died, these are my main sources of income," she says. Her life is based on hard work. Despite her own needs, she has always given a good education to her children, who are now professionals. She has seven cows which produce an average of 48 liters of milk per day, which she sells to a milk distributor. She also plants potatoes and corn in several of her own agricultural plots in her town. 

She would now like to improve her cows' milk production. She belongs to the "Niño Jesús" communal bank, and this is her eighth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity to progress, and she promises to make her payments on time. She also enjoys being a member of her association, where everyone is united and supportive.

María will invest this loan in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo, 37 years old, is married and has a child. His wife works as a saleslady in the city. Domingo is a tricycle driver and also has a retail store. While he provides motorcycle transport services within their village, his mother helps him to manage the store. Domingo usually earns PHP 3,000 each month in his store. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more grocery supplies, such as canned goods, breads, eggs and noodles, to sell. In the future, Domingo hopes to keep making his businesses profitable and to help his wife save money for their expenses.

loans.use: to buy more grocery supplies, such as canned goods, breads, eggs and noodles, to sell

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Don Oswaldo es divorciado y tiene una hija, que está en etapa de lactancia, vive en casa de sus papas, donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio, la cocina y el baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Bajo Tacagua, de la Ciudad de La Paz, esta ubicada en un pasaje y por las noches hay poca iluminación.
Actualmente trabaja por las mañanas en una empresa y por las tardes se dedica a comercializar y vender las agendas y revistas por la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz acomodando los productos en las oficinas de las empresas; trabaja todos los días de la semana. Su trabajo es independiente trabajando actualmente en la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz, sostiene a su familia con el pago de los servicios y comida de su hija.
El crédito lo requiere para mercadería (más agendas y revistas) ya que cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo con el cual tiene poco movimiento en sus ventas, el crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida en la que vive.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is divorced and has one daughter, who is breastfeeding. He lives in his parents' house, where he has a good environment with a room, a kitchen, and a bathroom. The home is made of adobe with cement floors and is located in the area of Bajo Tacagua in the city of La Paz. Since the house is in a passageway, there is little lighting at night.

He currently spends his mornings working for a company, and in the afternoons he markets and sells agendas and magazines in company offices in the southern part of La Paz. He works every day of the week, and his work in the south of the city is independent. He sustains his family by paying for services and food for his daughter.

He needs this loan in order to buy merchandise (more agendas and magazines), because he has very little working capital and thus little sales activity. This loan will help him to improve his income and his quality of life. This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy agendas and magazines to sell in the southern area of La Paz.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es: Vivian en sus confecciones le está yendo muy bien, ella recibió previamente un credikiva y con él, compró materias primas e insumos y fabricó vestidos, con los que respondió a los pedidos de su clientela y hoy se preparar para la época de las festividades del carnaval de Barranquilla, elaborando lindos disfraces, con los que ha logrado conquistar a sus compradores y potencializar una nueva clientela; siendo así,  su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para responder la demanda y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para fabricar vestidos con motivos carnestolenticos y disfraces encargados. Su negocio está lleno de hermosos y brillantes  colores con los que fabricará la ropa que lucirán sus clientes en los carnavales, en los cuales disfrutaran del jolgorio la camaradería y el baile,  porque definitivamente como dice la canción: “Barranquilla la muy popular tiene swing para bailar la cumbia y el mapalé”. Por eso ella expresa que “agradece el apoyo recibido de Kiva, pues  con él ha podido sostener e impulsar su negocio, fortaleciéndolo cada día mas”.
texts.en: Vivian is doing well with her sewing, she previously received a Kiva loan and bought basic materials and supplies to sew clothes, therein meeting her customers' orders. She is currently preparing for the festival season with the Barranquilla carnival, making beautiful costumes with which she has managed to win over her customers and bolster a new customer base. Nevertheless, her working capital is insufficient to meet the demand, and this is precisely why she is seeking a new Kiva loan to buy the basic materials and supplies to produce clothes for carnivals and costumes that have been ordered by her customers. Her business is full of beautiful and brilliant colors with which she makes the clothes that her customers will show off in the carnivals in which they will enjoy the merrymaking, camaraderie and dance because, as the song goes “The ever so popular Barranquilla has swing to dance cumbia and mapalé.” That is why Vivian says that she is "grateful for the help received from Kiva as it was using the loan that she was able to sustain and drive her business, strengthening it that bit more every day."

loans.use: to buy the basic materials and supplies to sew clothes for carnivals and costumes that have been ordered.

loans.name: Jeenbubu

texts.ru: Жеенбубу 46 лет, мать 2 детей. Жеенбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи с 2000 года занимается откормом и разведением скота. Начатое 9.000 KGS хозяйство благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду Жеенбубу насчитывает на сегодня 2 голов коров и 10 голов мелкого и приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жеенбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на 2 коров для увеличени доходов от продажи молока. Доходы Жеенбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, Все доходы она планирует вкладывать в образование детей и их будущее.
texts.en: Jeenbubu is a 46-year-old mother of two.  Since the year 2000, Jeenbubu has provided the main source of income for her family by raising and breeding cattle.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Jeenbubu began her farm with 9,000 KGS and now has two cows and ten goats .  She brings in around 5,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy products and the reselling of cattle. With the goal of further developing her business, Jeenbubu turned to Bai Tumum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy two cows in order to increase her incоme from the sale of milk.  Jeenbubu plans to reinvest the increased income in her business, as well as to save for her children's education and future.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илмхомчон  обратился в МДО «Арванд» для получения кредита, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.  Он содержит дома несколько голов скота. Эта основная его работа , в их регионе откорм скота и выращивание сель-хоз. культуры являются очень актуальными , поэтому он  всерьез занимается этим делом, чтобы прокормить свою семью.  У него большая семья и работа в кишлаке хватает, но не на всех, многие уезжают в Россию на заработки, но Илхомчон не хочет уезжать  в чужую страну и старается жить и работать на родине. Ильхомчон старается развивать свой бизнес по животноводству и делает все возможное чтобы его семья жила в достатке.
 На полученный кредит Ильхомчон планирует купить несколько голов скота и расширить свой бизнес. Он заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Ilhomjon turned to Arvand for a loan in order to buy more cattle to add to the few he already owns.  This is his main work.  In his region, raising cattle and cultivating agriculture is a very important practice.  Therefore, he takes it very seriously in order to support his large family.  There's work in his village, but not enough for everyone.  Many travel to Russia to earn money, but Ilhomjon doesn't want to travel to a foreign country and tries to live and work in his homeland. Ilhomjon is trying to grow his business and he does everything possible to ensure that his family lives prosperously.  With this loan, Ilhomjon plans to buy a few head of cattle and expand his business.  He thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi, de 30 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su hija Marisela, en la casa de su padre desde que nació. Hace algunos años abrió una tienda de comestibles en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ahí vendía bien y tenía muchas ganancias. Pero tuvo una propuesta económica de un hospital, por lo que empezó a trabajar ahí todos los días. Recibe un buen sueldo, con el que puede mantener a su hija, mientras que dure su trabajo, ella alquiló su tienda de comestibles con la esperanza de volver a tener su trabajo y así mejorar sus ingresos. Ahora desea mejorar su casa y así brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su hija, quien ya tendrá su propio cuarto, según menciona Noemi. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Noemí, invertirá el dinero en la remodelación de la habitacion de su hija, para ello comprará materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Noemi, aged 30, is a hardworking woman. She has lived with her daughter Marisela in her parents' house since she was born.

A few years ago, she opened a food store in a space in the house that she converted for this purpose. Her products sold well, and she earned a lot. However, she received a financial offer from a hospital, and so she started to work there every day. She earns a good wage, which allows her to support her daughter. During this work, she rented out her food shop with the hope of being able to return to work there and increase her earnings. 

Now, she wants to make home improvements, thereby giving her daughter a good quality of life. She already has her own bedroom, according to Noemi. She belongs to the “Niño Jesús” (Baby Jesus) community bank, and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity to move forwards, and promises to make her repayments in time. She also likes belonging to her bank, where everyone is united. 

Noemi will invest the money in remodeling her daughter's room, for which she will buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Dong's Group

texts.en:
Dong is the leader of Dong's Group. She was born in 1966. She has three children, one is a soldier, the others are workers. They have all married. Her husband is a doorman. His income is VND 4,000,000 per month. Dong raises chickens to earn a living. She gains VND 3,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 12,000,000 per month. 

Dong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens. Her dream is to enlarge her farm of chickens.
	
Other members whom are part of Dong's Group include the following: 
	 
Nguyet is 59 years old. She has four children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens. 
	 
Lan is 41 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for her pigs. 
	 
Ngoc is 41 years old. She has four children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens.
	 
Trang is 25 years old. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou, âgé de 33 ans, et père de 2 enfants dont la fille a 3 ans et le garçon 5 ans. Il fait du commerce de produits cométiques et a acquis une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans ce domaine. Il commence sa journée à 8h et la fini à 18h du soir .Ce crédit lui permettra de diversifier ses produits et d’offrir à sa clientèle une large gamme de produits aux choix. Il gère sa petite famille et s’occupe de leur besoins aux quotidiens. Son souhait serait de devenir autonome et ne plus emprunter de l’argent dans les banques.
texts.en: Mister Saliou, 33 years old, is father to 2 children of whom the girl is 3 years old and the boy is 5 years old. He sells cosmetic products and has acquired more than five years experience in this domain. He starts his day at 8am and finishes it at 6pm at night. This loan will allow him to diversify his products and to offer his clientele a large range of products to choose from. He manages his little family and takes care of their needs daily. His wish would be to become autonomous and to no longer borrow money from banks.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
La señora Lusmila es madre soltera; tiene un salón de fiestas; su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa familiar ocupando tres habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre en la zona de Sopocachi   de la ciudad de la Paz. 
Luzmila alquila su salón de fiestas cada fin de semana, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de su hijo y otros
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su salón de fiestas para ofrecer mejor calidad y así mejorar su sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

El sueño de Lusmila es que su hijo termine sus estudios

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Lusmila is a single mother, and she owns a party venue. She has a highschool education, and she lives in a three bedroom family house with a finely finished tongue and groove wood floor in the Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.

Lusmila rents her party venue each weekend to cover the costs of food, electricity, her son's education, and other expenses. She needs credit for the renovation of the party room to offer better quality and to improve her income and quality of life. Lusmila's dream is that her son will finish his studies. This is her first time with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: with the cost of the renovation of her party room, which she rents and receives income to support herself and her son.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo es comerciante, vende artículos de cotillón, vive en casa propia ocupando una habitación en un acabado de adobe y piso de cemento en la zona de Alto San Pedro  de la ciudad de la Paz.
Arturo vende sus productos para cubrir sus gastos de agua, luz, transporte y otros.
El crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de su capital de trabajo y comprar más artículos de cotillón para  así mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Arturo es tener un local propio donde vender sus productos.

Esta es la décimo tercera vez que acude a Impro y la décima vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Arturo is a businessman. He sells cotillion items, and lives in his own home, in one adobe room with a cement floor in Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Arturo sells his products to pay for his water, electricity, transport and other expenses. He needs this loan to increase his working capital and buy more party decorations so that he can increase his earnings. 

Arturo's dream is to have his own store in which to sell his products.

This is his thirteenth loan with Impro and tenth loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy used party items to decorate parties and to sell.

loans.name: Vu's Group

texts.en:
Vu is the leader of Vu's Group. She was born in 1970. She has two sons. The older son is a worker. The younger son is four years old. Her husband is a building worker. His income is VND 3,000,000 per month. Vu is a worker. She also raises chickens to earn more money for her family. She gains VND 3,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 9,000,000 per month. 

Vu has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens. Her dream is to let her children have good careers.
	
Other members whom are part of Vu's group include the following: 
	 
Huyen was born in 1990. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens. 
	 
Lap was born in 1950. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy groceries to sell. 
	 
My was born in 1953. She has four children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.
      
Chung was born in 1980. She has two children. She sells stones to earn a living. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to enlarge her store of stones.
	 
Ha was born in 1973. She has two children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for pigs.
	 
Hoi was born in 1971. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Sope Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sope Dabakh est un groupe qui rassemble cinq personnes qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles ont à leur tête la dame Maguette la deuxième à partir de la gauche sur la photo, âgée de 23 ans et mère d’une petite fille de 1 an et demie. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et de produits cosmétiques qu’elle écoule dans le voisinage. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine d’activité. Elle commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 13h.
 Elle désire devenir autonome et ne plus dépendre des crédits au niveau des Institutions financières.
texts.en:
The credit group Sope Dabakh is a group that brings together five people who are active in shopkeeping. They have as their head the woman Maguette, the second from the left in the photo, 23 years old and mother to a little girl who is 1 and a half. She sells fabric and cosmetic products which she sells off in the neighborhood. She has 3 years experience in this business domain. She starts her day at 8am and finishes it at 1pm.

She wants to become autonomous and to not depend on loans from financial institutions anymore.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Tatiana Del Carmen

texts.es: Tintes, champó, y productos capilares, en general, es lo que va a comprar Tatiana para disponer de ellos  en su peluquería, pues hay mucha clientela que espera, adecuar su imagen a una de las fiestas mas lindas de Colombia, “Los Carnavales de Barranquilla”, así los brillos, peinados, colores, maquillaje alusivos al carnaval, lucirán en la piel   los clientes de Tatiana. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, pues con el comprará escacha, lacas,  tinturas y lacas. Ella en sus palabras “agradece la ayuda recibida de Kiva y desea que sigan desarrollando esta noble tarea en todo el país. Con su anterior credikiva le fue muy bien y logró comprar herramientas de trabajo, como un secador profesional, planchas para el cabello y hoy por eso está ofreciendo un buen servicio y está mucho mas cómoda trabajando; sus ventas se han incrementado y sus clientes se sienten mas satisfechos.
texts.en: Dyes, shampoo, and hair products in general are what Tatiana is going to buy in order to have them available in her hair salon, since there are many customers waiting to alter their appearance for one of the most beautiful festivals in Colombia, "The Carnivals of Barranquilla". Tatiana's customers will show off highlights, hairstyles, colors, and carnival-style makeup. This is why she is taking out a Kiva loan, since with it she will buy hair glitter, hairspray, and dye. She says she is thankful for the help received from Kiva, and she hopes they continue to develop this noble work throughout the country. Her previous Kiva loan went very well for her. She was able to buy tools for her work such as a professional hair dryer and hair irons, and as a result today she offers a good service and she is much more comfortable working. Her sales have increased and her customers are much more satisfied.

loans.use: to buy hair glitter, dye, and hairspray

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor Jose es empleado, su nivel de educación es técnico superior , vive en casa familiar ocupando 4 habitaciones en un acabado fino  y piso de machimbre
El señor Jose trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación y otros.
El crédito lo requiere para la  compra de una Laptop que le ayudará en su trabajo ya que él es auxiliar contable y está estudiando Contabilidad.
El sueño de Jose es terminar sus estudios.

Es la tercera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Jose is employed, and is educated as a senior technician. He lives in a house with four rooms and a finished, strip wood floor. Jose works 8 hours a day to cover the household expenses of food, light, water, education, and more. He is asking for this loan in order to buy a laptop which will help him in his work as an accounting assistant and while he studies to become an accountant. 

Jose's dream is to finish his studies. This is his third loan with IMPRO and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop that will help him with his work

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
El señor Gualberto  trabaja como policía; su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando dos  habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Las Lomas  de la ciudad de la Paz.

Gualberto trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz.

El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda (comprará cemento, arena, estuco y pinturas) y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Gualberto es terminar de construir su casa.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la segunda con Kiva.
texts.en:
Gualbert works as a police officer. He has a high school education, and he lives in his parents' two bedroom home with brick finish and cement floors in the Las Lomas district of the city of La Paz.

Gualberto works 8 hours a day to cover the costs of water and electricity. He needs the loan for the renovation of his home and to improve his quality of life. He will buy cement, sand, plaster, and paint

Gualberto's dream is to finish building his house. 

This is his second time with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement, plaster, and paint to renovate his parents' home.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo, de 25 años es un padre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su hijo Jamil en la casa de su madre desde que nació. Durante las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para poder alimentar a sus animales, entre cerdos, ovejas, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, ya que todo el resto del día trabajará como portero en una escuela de la localidad. Él desea mejorar su ganado, con animales de calidad, además de tener mayor cantidad, por lo que pensó en invertir en la compra de mayores ejemplares. Es así que recibió la invitación de una de las socias del banco para poder empezar a desarrollar su sueño. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Alfredo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 25 years old, a single father, and a laborer. He has lived with his son Jamil in his mother's house since he was born. 

He gets up early in the morning to feed his pigs and sheep, which his does with great care, since he spends the rest of the day working as a doorman at a local school. He wants to improve his livestock, with a greater number of high quality animals, which is why he has decided to invest in buying better specimens. This is how he received an invitation from one of the members of the “Niño Jesús” (Baby Jesus) community bank to begin to develop his dream. This will be Alfredo's first loan with MFP. He is grateful for the opportunity to progress, and promises to make his loan repayments on time. He also likes belonging to his bank, where everyone is united.

Alfredo will invest the money in buying sheep to increase his flock.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase his flock,

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora rosa maría vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como conserje en una empresa, Se caracteriza por ser responsable tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
 
Doña rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, hierro, y zinc para  hacerles mejoras a su vivienda. 

 Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, espera el apoyo ya que sin este crédito seria imposible realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa María lives in the city of Managua and works as a janitor.  She is characterized as responsible and has a school-aged son.  

Rosa is asking for a loan to buy cement, iron and corrugated roofing panels to make home improvements.  In order to improve her family's living conditions, she hopes to get this support as, without this loan, it would be impossible for her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, cinder blocks and iron.

loans.name: Bunvikane Group

texts.fr: Madame Dunia est une femme ambitieuse de l'association d'affaire Bunvikane. Agée de 28ans, mère de 5enfants dont 3 scolarisées est mariée à un conducteur de moto. Engagée dans le petit commerce, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de lait frais et cailleux qu'elle sert à la maison et au marché de mudaka.  Elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour financer l'achat de 10 bidons (20litres) et 10 seaux de lait comme elle rêve déjà devenir grossiste et collectrice/intermédiaire de lait. La cliente remercie Hekima du fait de l'avoir affermie dans le petit commerce.
texts.en: Madam Dunia is an ambitious woman from the business association Bunvikane. She is 28 years old, mother to 5 children of whom 3 go to school, and is married to a motorcycle driver. Involved in shopkeeping, she is specialized in the sale of fresh milk and curds which she serves at home and at the Mudaka market. She is requesting this new loan to finance the purchase of 10 cans (20L) and 10 buckets of milk as she is already dreaming of becoming a wholesaler and collector/middleman of milk. The client thanks Hekima for having strengthened her shopkeeping.

loans.use: to buy 10 cans (20L) and 10 buckets of milk.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold and his wife dream of having a big fabrication plant for farm equipment. Arnold started his business in 1991 as a small repair shop for farm machines and vehicles. Arnold has been in the business for 21 years.

Arnold is 46 years old, married and has three school age children. His wife is his partner in managing the business. Through their earned income from the business, Arnold and his wife are able to provide for their children schooling. Arnold is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy tools and equipments to run the business and extend their services to their customers. He hopes to have more customers and more income that will help him in reaching his goal.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipments to run the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est revendeuse d’objets en plastiques. Elle exerce son activité dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 10ans et  a un enfant  âgé de 10ans en charge.  Elle sollicite son troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des objets en plastiques afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Avec les profits qu’elle va réaliser,  massan  veut agrandir son activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Massan is a reseller of plastic objects. She practices her business in a local market and gets her supplies in Lomé. She has been in this field for 10 years and has one dependent child who is 10 years old. She is requesting her third loan from WAGES to buy plastic objects in order to better respond to the needs of her customers. With the profits that she is going to make, Massan wants to expand her business and ensure the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic objects.

loans.name: Concejo

texts.en:
Concejo is 70 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

Concejo is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation for fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Concejo has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream, which is to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marisa has requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Marisa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her child. She is married and has a feed supply business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Cecilia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 30 years old and married with one child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessica has a gravestone making business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional marble, paint, brushes, etc. for her business.

Jessica has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Jessica would like to send her child to school in order to earn a degree.

loans.use: to purchase additional marble, paint, brushes etc. for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been raising pigs for 1 year and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a widowed mother of three children. She manages a small tailoring business in their village. Remy learned the business when she worked as a sewer for someone who has a tailoring shop. Now Remy is sewing school and office uniforms. She also offers clothing repairs.
   
At her age of 57, Remy can still manage her business. Remy wishes for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy textiles to sew. She hopes to meet her costumers' demand for better services and good income as well. Remy wishes for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sew

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Helen would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dono

texts.fr: Âgée de 37ans et mère de 02 enfants tous à l’école, madame dono vit avec son conjoint chauffeur et leurs enfants à Lomé. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce d’igname dans un marché de la place depuis 2007. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour l’achat d’ignames. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Thirty-seven years old and mother to 2 children all in school, Madam Dono lives with her driver spouse and their children in Lomé. To help her spouse with the responsibilities of the home, she has been selling yams in a local market since 2007. In order to satisfy her clientele, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy yams. For the future, she wants to ensure the vital needs of her family while making her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Cristine requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Cristine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
A married parent of two children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Elsa is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery. She has sustained her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, respectivamente, su esposo es empleado en una empresa, donde se desempeña como vendedor y labora desde el año 2007.

Ella se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa de familias que viven dentro de la comunidad; por lo que les cobra $3.00 cada docena de piezas de vestir. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 5 años; pues, ella anteriormente trabajó como empleada domestica.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de un closet, mueble que le hace falta en su hogar para mantener ordenadas sus prendas de vestir y una mesa de comedor que le sirva para atender a su familia y personas que le visiten.

Cabe mencionar que hace dos años vivían con los suegros y que con fuertes sacrificios han construido su vivienda con bloque y que aun no está terminada y que es importante para ellos el tener estos muebles del hogar para mantener limpias y ordenada su casa.

Lo que desea realizar más adelante, es Solicitar financiamiento para construir el piso de su casa con cemento, actualmente, es de tierra y quiere emprender en el negocio de venta de ropa cuando su ultimo hijo cumpla los 6 años de edad.
texts.en:
Antonia, 27, lives with her husband and their 2 children, aged 4 and 2.  Her husband has been working as a salesman for a company since 2007.  

Antonia has a business washing and ironing clothes for families in her community.  She charges them $3.00 for a dozen pieces of clothing.  She has been doing this kind of work for more than 5 years.  Previously, she worked as a domestic.

Antonia will invest this loan in a closet, which is something she doesn't have in her home, so that she can keep her garments neat.   She will also buy a dining table that her family and visitors to the home can use.

It's worth mentioning that 2 years ago the family was living with her in-laws, but because of big sacrifices they have managed to build their home out of cement blocks.  Even though the house is not yet finished, it is important for them to have some furniture in the house to keep things neat and tidy.

In the future, Antonia wants to get a loan to put in a cement floor, because they currently have a dirt floor.  She also wants to start up a business selling clothing once her youngest daughter turns 6.

loans.use: to buy a closet

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 34 years old and married with three children.

Leslie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Leslie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of rice grains business for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

Leslie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old and has three children. Jessica is married and all three children are in school.

Jessica is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jessica has been raising pigs for 15 years and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Anabelle works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Anabelle is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food business.

Anabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her businesss.

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a footwear retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like slippers, shoes and other footwear.

Chuchi has been in this business for 30 years. Chuchi earns more income from her general store.

Chuchi has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like slippers, shoes and other footwear.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo, binder, and other fishing equipment.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binder, and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 49 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, candies, groceries, etc. 

Melba requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, candies, groceries, etc. in her general store.

In the future, Melba would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, candies,  groceries, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
